loans.name: Elpedia

texts.en: Elpedia is 54 years old, married and has six children.  She lives in Cabungaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Elpedia owns farmland, planting bananas and coconuts to earn a living.  She has been in this business for ten years and earns 5,000 PHP each month. Elpedia has been a member of  GDMPC since 2009 and has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP in order to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In the future, Elpedia hopes to improve her family’s general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Judith's Group

texts.en:
Judith is the leader of a 5 person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

Judith is married and has 2 children. Judith is 61 years old and lives in Bagalupa, Labangan, Zamboanga del Sur.

Judith sells dry goods to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 40,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 25,000 PHP to purchase inventory to sell in her store.

Judith has a member of PMPC for less than a year. In the future, Judith hope to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell in her store

location.town: Pagadian - Bagalupa, Labangan, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a 36-year-old married woman who lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has two children to care for. She has been engaged in providing manicure and pedicure services for five years to earn a living. She earns a monthly income of 3,200 PHP from this job. 

Rosalinda is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase manicure and pedicure accessories for her business. She hopes to earn more income to ensure a better future for her family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase manicure and pedicure accessories

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
This is Rowena, 42, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Macario, a driver and is a mother to her children. She and her husband are managing their household while operating the business. They are working hand in hand to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rowena owns and oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. She has a one unit (14-16 person capacity) jeepney, from which she receives a boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Rowena hopes to have additional jeepney for her growing business and dreams of having a good and peaceful life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

-Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and corn seedlings.

loans.name: Mariano Jr.

texts.en: Mariano Jr. is a vegetable farmer from the town of Bohol, Philippines. He is a married man and a father of two children. Mariano Jr. has been in the business for more than five years now. Mariano Jr. is asking for a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer. Through this loan, he will be able to plant more and increase his harvest. In the future, Mariano Jr. dreams of making his farming business a success so that it will generate more income necessary for the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Bernardo is is a 57-year-old married man. He has ten children and lives in San Jose with his family. He is a farmer, growing crops like corn and rice. He has been in agriculture since 2007, and he works six days a week. Every day he works seven hours in the farm. 

He sells his products to traders from their town. He hopes to be the leading supplier of agriculture products in his area, if he gets enough capital to invest in the business. 

He has applied for this loan to buy pesticides and fertilizers for his crops. His major challenges are the weather, which is unpredictable, and acquiring pesticides, which are quite expensive. He also lacks sufficient capital for large-scale growing.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Lan is 54 years old and widowed with a son. She has been running a grocery store to sell fruit for 25 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her son. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Lan is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more kinds of fruit to sell. This will enable her to attract more customers and increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan, she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Sevarniso

texts.ru:
Севарнисо 25лет, воспитывает одного ребенка. Севарнисо  работает преподавателем кыргызского языка с местной школе и в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи,  занимается животноводством , стартовав 5 лет назад  с суммы 9,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду,  Севарнисо на сегодняшний день имеет прибыль (KGS) 13,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Севарнисо обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота.  Доходы от кредита Севарнисо планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность достойно обеспечивать свою семью.
texts.en: Sevarniso is 25 years old and raising one child.  Sevarniso works as a Kyrgyz language teacher at a school and, to provide an additional source of income for her family, is involved in animal husbandry, having started five years ago with a sum of 9,000 som.  Thanks to her persistent work, today she has a profit of 13,000 som (KGS) per month.  In order to further develop her business, Sevarniso requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the micro-finance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a further growth of her business in order to have an ability to provide well for her family.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Sor Liliana

texts.es:
Sor, es una joven a la que le ha tocado luchar incansablemente para obtener mejores condiciones de vida, lo que es y lo que tiene lo ha construido a pulso con esfuerzo y mucho sacrificio. 
Laboró en varios restaurantes de su localidad, pero desde hace siete meses decidió independizarse y montar su propio negocio dedicado a la venta de comidas rápidas, bebidas y dulces con el fin de mejorar su condición económica y brindarle a su madre una mejor calidad de vida. Asegura que el negocio ha tenido una buena acogida por parte de la comunidad, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido y una nevera para la conservación de los alimentos, mejorando la rentabilidad y el servicio.
Sueña con seguir creciendo dentro del sector y montar más puntos de venta.
texts.en: Sor is a young woman who fights tirelessly to give herself a better quality of life, what she has, she has made herself, through hard work and sacrifice. She has worked in various restaurants in her neighborhood, but seven months ago, she decided to branch out on her own and to start her own business where she sells fast food, drinks and sweets. Her goal is to improve her economic situation and to give her mother a better quality of life. She assures us that her business has been welcomed by the community and, so, she is asking for a credit that she will invest in the purchase of supplies and a refrigerator so she can conserve her foods and improve the profitability and service of her business. Her dream is to continue to grow her business and to open new locations.

loans.use: purchase supplies and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Rosevilla

texts.en:
Rosevilla is from Gango, Ozamis City. She is 40 years old, married and has four children. To make a living, Rosevilla owns a transportation services business in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for three years and earns 2,000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Rosevilla joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business.

loans.name: Jenemar's Group

texts.en:
Jenemar is the group leader of a five-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member has her own business.

Jenemar is 28 years old and lives in Bagalupa, Labangan, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with 2 children. Jenemar has a store that sells dry goods. She has had this business for 4 years, and is requesting a loan to buy additional dry goods to sell.

Jenemar has been a member of PMPC for less than a year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase dry goods

location.town: Pagadian - Bagalupa, Labangan, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is applying for a loan of $1,000 USD from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 38 years old, married and has 5 children.  She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as Hard drinks (beer),soft drinks (Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko) eggs,  oil, sugar, biscuits and rice. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. 

Filomena is living in a town near by the school.  Her kiosk is located in strategic place where many people come to buy including students, and she is happy with (TRM Tuba Rai Metin) that offers loans to poor people. Her husband is a farmer.

loans.use: to buy hard drinks (beer), soft drinks (Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko) eggs, oil, sugar, biscuits and rice

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is 47 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has five children.  Felomina is engaged in a carinderia business (eatery) and earns approximately PHP3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional meat, rice and other ingredients for her existing business. 
Felomina has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Felomina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional meat, rice and other ingredients

loans.name: Pearl Grace

texts.en: Pearl Grace of Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City is a 34-year-old woman who is married with three little children. To earn a living, she owns a sari-sari store selling dry goods in the local community with an income of 10,000 PHP monthly. In 2011, she became a member of GDMPC and is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. She always dreams of expanding to a bigger general store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Germelina's Group

texts.en:
Germelina is 58 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 7 children. Germelina is engaged in the dried fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 2,000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing construction materials for house repair.

Germelina has been a member of PMPC for almost 10 years. In the future, Germelina hopes to expand her business. Germelina is the leader of a 2 person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Gold Center Group

texts.en:
Porsosa is 45 years old and lives in Dao Pagadian City Philippines. She is married with 3 children.

Porsosa has had a bag-making business for 15 years and earns approximately 20,000 each month doing this type of work. She requested a loan to purchase more stock for her bag-making business.

Porsosa has been a member for 5 years. In the future, she hopes to build a big shop.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her bag-making business.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 50 years old and lives in Baga, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 4 children.

Nida is engaged in the coconut buying and selling business and earns approximately PHP 1,000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional coconuts for her copra and nut-selling business.

Nida has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years. In the future, Nida hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts for copra and nut selling.

loans.name: Nelly's Group

texts.en:
Nelly is 53 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 4 children.

Nelly is engaged in curtain-making and dressmaking activities and earns approximately PHP 1,200.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional cloth and accessories for her curtain-making and dressmaking activities.

Nelly has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Nelly hopes to expand her business. Nelly is the leader of a 2-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase additional cloth and accessories.

loans.name: Clara Yohana

texts.es: Clara a sus 29 años de edad, se visiona como una gran empresaria, desde hace cinco años se dedica al diseño y fabricación de calzado desde su hogar. Actividad que aprendió gracias a su padre quien laboró por muchos años en la actividad. Con el fin de cumplir con los pedidos hechos por sus clientes, Clara se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos como cuero, tela, pegante, entre otros. Con esta inversión podrá aumentar sus ventas y generar mayores ingresos con el fin de brindarle a su hija de 12 años de edad una buena educación y mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Clara, 29, sees herself as sees herself as a great entrepreneur.  She has designed and made footwear from her home for five years.  She learned the job thanks to her father, who worked for many years in that field.

Clara's requesting a loan to invest in buying leather, fabric, glue, and other supplies so she can fill her customers' orders.  With this investment she'll be able to increase her sales and generate greater income so she can give her 12-year-old daughter a good education and better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy leather, fabric, and glue

loans.name: Joselito

texts.en:
Joselito is a 46-year-old man from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. He has been engaged in the water-refilling business for more than two years now. This is his source of income.

Joselito is asking for a loan to buy more water gallons for his water-refilling business. He hopes to make his venture a success .

loans.use: to buy more water gallons.

loans.name: Althiane

texts.en: Althiane is a 41-year-old married woman with four children living in Taboo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She has been selling fish in the local community for 5 years, earning PHP 2,500 a month for a living. In 2011, Althiane joined GDMPC micro credit to gain financial access and is now requesting a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase additional variety of fish to sale. She dreams to send her children to school and would finish their study.

loans.use: to purchase additional variety of fish to sale

loans.name: Sreyda

texts.en:
Sreyda, 24, is from a rural village located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She and her husband earn a living by growing rice on seven hectares of farmland. In this business for 10 years, they earn about 32,000 KHR per day.

New to VisionFund, Sreyda is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice on time so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta, a 59-year-old woman, is married with 3 children and lives in Hinagdong, Ozamiz City. To earn a living, she buys and sells seaweed and also has a store. She has been in this business for 5 years and earns 4,000 a month. This year, she joined GDMPC and then requested a loan of 5,000.00 PHP to purchase additional inventory and to have additional working capital. She plans to improve her store and repair their house.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and have more working capital.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 68 years old and widowed. She lives in Tinaclaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a banana farm, planting and harvesting bananas for sale in the local community to earn a living. She has been in this business for over ten years and earns 6,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to pay the costs of banana farm weeding and maintenance. In the future, she wants to make improvements on her house and to have better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to pay the costs of banana farm weeding and maintenance

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en: Suriya is 54-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of 3-children. Her husband owns a milk shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. As the summer season has started, her husband wants to purchase a refrigerator for preserving milk. However, due to the lack of income he finds it difficult. Therefore, his wife Suriya is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase a refrigerator. With the profits her husband wants to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator for preserving milk

loans.name: Alona

texts.en: Alona, is a 41-year-old woman, married, has four children and lives in Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For a living, she owns and manages her sari sari store selling goods in the local community for the past 5 years and has an income of 2,500 PHP a month. She became a member of GDMPC in the year 2010 to gain access to financial sources. She is now requesting 3,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product selection. She plans to repair her house to improve the entire family's living condition.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product selection

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is 41 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 2 children. 

Hazel is engaged in the farming industry, particularly in rice production and earns approximately 4,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing fertilizers for her rice production activity. 

Hazel has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Hazel hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Nellie

texts.en:
Nellie is 47 years old and lives in Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 2 children. 

Nellie is engaged in poultry raising and earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional sacks of feed for her poultry raising business. 

Nellie has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Nellie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional sacks of feed

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat is a 35 year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. She owns a stitching school. Income generated from her business plays a vital role in the family's income. Presently, she wants to purchase a sewing machine for the school. However, due to the lack of finances she finds it difficult. Therefore, Nusrat has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase a sewing machine. Nusrat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase sewing machine.

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Mao is aged 30 years and married. She lives with her husband and one daughter, in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer on two hectares of farmland. She has been a rice farmer for ten years, while her husband catches fish. The current business earns her family about 22,000 KHR per day, and she manages to save about 14,000 KHR each day after covering the cost of living.

This is the first loan for Mao with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The other group member has been with VisionFund for one previous loan cycle. Now Mao is leading her group to apply for a new loan. Mao will use her portion of the loan funds to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to have the field plowed. She hopes this loan will enable her family to earn more income from her rice paddy business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to have the field prepared for planting rice

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Doña Isabel de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica  ala venta de ropa desde hace 7 años, y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo es de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden y al gusto de los clientes; doña isabel es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor y muy luchadora día con día,  desea hacer una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa faldas, pantalones, camisas, blusas, shorts, etc. ella asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Isabel is 50 years old and lives in her own home with her husband. She has been selling clothing for 7 years and she has gotten a lot of experience that leads to her earning better earnings. Her business is located in her home and she has many customers because people know that her merchandise is of good quality at affordable prices and that her service is unequaled and her customers really enjoy shopping there. Isabel is an enterprising woman, dedicated to her business and a hard worker day after day. She is interested in a new investment, but she doesn't have enough money to do so and, so, she is asking INTEGRAL for a credit that will help her to purchase skirts, pants, shirts, blouses, shorts and more. She assures us that she will repay her debt and she is also hopeful that the new investment will provide her home with more economic security.

loans.use: purchase skirts, pants, shirts, blouses, shorts and more.

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es:
Verónica de 26 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de tres años, A raíz de la separación con su cónyuge debió asumir todas las responsabilidades del hogar, por lo cual inició laborando como vendedora en el almacén de su hermana, pero debido a que ella debió radicarse en la ciudad de Medellín ofreció vendérselo a lo ella aceptó y hoy es la propietaria. Lleva cinco meses como dueña del negocio y asegura que las ventas son buenas, lo que la ha impulsado a solicitar un crédito para terminar de pagarle a su hermana e invertir en surtido. 
Sueña con ver crecer su negocio y no sólo dedicarse a la venta de ropa interior y accesorios si no introducir nuevas líneas de productos.
texts.en:
Verónica, age 26, is the single mother of a three year old.  Because she separated from her husband, she needed to take on the household responsibilities.  Therefore, she started working as a salesperson in her sister’s store.  

However, because her sister had to move to the city of Medellín, she offered to sell her business to Verónica.  She accepted, and she is now the owner.  She has had the business for five months, and she affirms that the sales are good.  This has driven her to request a loan in order to finish paying her sister and to invest in stock.

She dreams of seeing her business grow and of selling not only underwear and accessories.  She dreams of introducing new lines of products.

loans.use: to finish paying for her business and to buy stock.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is married with 3 children. She is 53 years old and lives in Gata Daku, Clarin.

Gilda sells variety of products to earn a living. She has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns 1500 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 3000 PHP to to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, and other items. 

Gilda has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.  In the future, Gilda hope to save more money for her children education.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, and other items.

location.town: Tudela-Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Mind

loans.name: Bienvenido

texts.en:
Bienvenido is 57 years old and lives in Northern Poblacion, Calamba. He is married and blessed with four children. 

To make a living, he is engaged in a service sector, primarily as a technician. Bienvenido earns 3,500 PHP monthly for this activity. He has been doing this kind of work for five years. 

Bienvenido is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP to pay for his child's tuition fee. He has been a member of Paglaum MPC for a year.

loans.use: to pay for his child's tuition fee.

loans.name: Aut

texts.en:
Aut is 33 years old, married, and has two children. She dedicates to work in the rice-farming business, from which she can add more to her husband’s income. Aut and her husband very much wanted to get ahead in their businesses and improve the quality of their living conditions. Aut’s husband has to travel by a motor taxi to be employed at a rubber plantation in other districts of the province. It would be better if they owned a motorcycle for travelling to far-distant areas.

Aut is requesting this loan from HKL and Kiva to buy a motorcycle to help her husband commute to work. With a motorcycle he would not have to pay to ride a motor taxi to his workplace, and he could save the money for their household financial solvency. She believes that the loan will give her and her family a comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to help her husband commute to work.

loans.name: Tessie's Group

texts.en:
Tessie is 49 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children.
 
Tessie is engaged in beautification services, particularly in manicure and pedicure activity and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional manicure and pedicure sets and other accessories. 

Tessie has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Tessie hopes to expand her business. Tessie is the leader of a two-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase additional manicure and pedicure sets

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
This is Allan, 46, resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. He is married to Erlinda, a vendor, and is a father to his children. He, together with his wife, manages their household while operating his business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Allan sells different towels. He has colored towels, designed towels, borlas towels and others. He also has a mini food stall where he sells coffee and sandwiches. He earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy different kinds of towels and products for his food stall. 

Allan hopes that his business will grow even more. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for different kinds of towels and products for his food stall.

loans.name: Gerelchuluun

texts.en:
Mr. Gerelchuluun, 25 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2012. Before driving a taxi, he had worked as a bone-setter for five years. This year his wife is graduating from a technical university majoring in machinery and technology.

The family has recently purchased land and an old wooden house. The house they bought is old and has fragile walls so Gerelchuluun is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase building materials necessary for house renovation such as bricks, planks, cement and iron. As a result, he and his family can live in a comfortable and warm place, reducing their coal consumption, releasing fewer pollutants and then contributing to the efforts against air pollution as a responsible citizens who care for and protect the environment. The borrower is very hardworking individual who cares for his family deeply.

loans.use: to purchase building materials.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 41 years old and lives in Sibaroc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has five children.  Analyn is engaged in gardening and in a hog raising activity and earns approximately PHP800 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing fertilizers and sacks of feeds for her business activities. 
Analyn has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Analyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing fertilizers and sacks of feeds

loans.name: Sufina

texts.en:
Sufina is 36 years old, married, and has seven children. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to increase the size of her business, but she does not have enough working capital. 

Sufina felt better when she applied for her first loan, and is now applying for her second loan of 1,000 USD. With this loan, she will buy additional supplies to keep in her store including soft drinks (such as Coca-Cola, Fanta, Sprite, and Sagiko), beer, cigarettes, biscuits, noodles, water, fish, slippers, eggs, and body lotion. She is happy with TRM and the loans that it offers to poor people.

loans.use: To buy items such as soft drinks, beer, cigarettes, buiscuits, noodles, water, fish, slippers, eggs, and body lotion

loans.name: Leziel

texts.en: Leziel is 37 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has three children. Leziel is engaged in a hog raising activity and earns approximately PHP5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase more feeds for her pigs. Leziel has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Leziel hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Ulziisaikhan

texts.en: Mrs. Ulziisaikhan, 46 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. She has been working as a hairdresser at a barbershop for five years. Her husband works at a power station and his main duty is to visit households and notch their electricity consumption in his book. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to install vacuum insulated windows into her house. The house has windows that are vulnerable to strong storms and frost. After installation of the vacuum windows, she can use her house as a barbershop and begin her own hairdressing service. This way, she can generate more income for her family and provide more opportunity for her son's education. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to install vacuum windows in the house to run a barbershop

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.en: Eulogia is from Maquilao, Tangub City. She is 56 years old. Eulogia is married with two children. To make a living, Eulogia operates a fishing business where she buys and sells fish to local community members. Eulogia has been in her business for 20 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Eulogia joined GDMPC. Eulogia is requesting a loan of 11,500 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Silvia Lorena

texts.es: Doña Silvia de 44 años de edad  vive junto a su familia en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, plátanos, naranjas, tomates, cebollas, chiles entre otros tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el lugar donde comercia es muy estratégico para la actividad y además muy concurrido de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere porque su producto es fresco, a buen precio, de calidad y con un excelente servicio; doña silvia es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre está buscando alternativas que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar frutas y verduras por mayor. Silvia  tiene buenas referencias de pago, esta agradecida con el apoyo y asegura que podrá saldar la deuda, a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Silvia, age 44, lives with her family in her own house.  She sells fruits and vegetables like bananas, oranges, tomatoes, onions, and chilies, among others.  She has had the business for several years, and it has gifted her with a lot of sales experience that allows her to get better profits.

The place where she sells is very strategic to her business activity, and it is very crowded.  She now has a lot of clientele who prefer her because her product is fresh, it is a good price and quality, and it has excellent service.  

Silvia is an enterprising woman who works with a great desire to get ahead.  She is always looking for choices that will allow her to be successful.  Demand has increased in the last few weeks, and she wants to take advantage of this by making a new investment.  However, she does not have enough capital to support this.  

That is why she is requesting a loan from Integral that will allow her to buy wholesale fruits and vegetables.  Silvia has good payment references.  She is grateful for the support, and she affirms that she will be able to repay the debt.  She trusts that she will give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith, 33 years old, is a married entrepreneur who lives in Tinac-laan, Clarin.  She is earning P6,000 a month  from her banana farm business, which she started almost five years ago.  To improve business, Judith is borrowing PHP 14,000 from GDMPC micro credit, which she just joined recently, to pay for the farm weeding maintenance costs.  She’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding her banana farm to have a better future.

loans.use: to pay for the farm weeding maintenance costs

loans.name: Nora's Group

texts.en:
Nora is 62 years old and lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has six children.  Nora is engaged in snack vending activity and earns approximately PHP600 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.
Nora has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Nora hopes to expand her business.  Nora is the leader of a two person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Sandra Brigida

texts.en: Sandra Brigida is 39 years old and lives in Maloro, Tangub City. She is single and has no children. Sandra Brigida has a piggery business and earns approximately 15,000 each month doing this type of business. She has requested a loan to purchase more pigs.  Sandra Brigida has been a member of PMPC for two months. In the future, Sandra Brigida hopes to invest her profits.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is from Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old and married. Elenita owns and operates a  farming business, planting and harvesting corn for sale. Elenita has been doing this for almost 20 years and earns 13,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2007, Elenita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to pay for the weeding maintenance of her farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for the weeding maintenance of her farm

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 45 years old and lives in Mantic, Tangub City. She is married with four children.

Margarita has an ice-making business and earns approximately 3,500 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for her business.

Margarita has been a member of PMPC for two months. In the future, Margarita hopes to invest her profits.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en: Natividad is a farmer and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She is 51 years old and lives in Cabunga-an, Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is married and has one child. Natividad has a requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy piglets for hog fattening. Natividad has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to be successful in her chosen business.

loans.use: To purchased piglets

loans.name: Ana Dolores

texts.es: Doña ana vive en casa propia con su esposo, su hija y sus dos nietos, ella tiene un negocio de venta de elotes en el mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela pues su producto es fresco y la da a un precio accesible, con las ganancias que obtiene y la ayuda de su esposo y su hija logran sacar adelante los gastos del hogar, doña Ana solicita un crédito que le permita comprar elotes por mayor para seguir con su negocio y poder darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Ana lives in her own house with her husband, her daughter, and her two grandchildren.  She has a business selling corn at the market that is close to her house.  She has a lot of clientele.  Her product is fresh, and she sells for reasonable prices.  With the profits that she gets, and with help from her husband and her daughter, they manage to get ahead with the household expenses.

Ana is requesting a loan that will allow her to buy corn wholesale in order to continue with her business and to be able to give her family better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale.

loans.name: Ehab

texts.en: Ehab is 36 years old and is from Gaza.  He is married and has four children, two of whom attend elementary school.  He has owned a fruit and vegetable stall since 2011.  Ehab asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a small automobile to transfer the goods. Through this loan, he will be able to cut the transportation cost and thus improve his financial income.

loans.use: to buy a small automobile to transfer the goods and lower the transportation cost.

loans.name: Alfonia's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Alfonia L., who is 62 years old and widow, is a resident of Cogon, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC.  For her living, she decided to engage in operating a general store business.  She is earning an average net income of not less than 3,000 a month, which is helpful to their family income.  She is requesting an amount of 15,000 PHP to purchase canned goods for her general store. The future income from this loan will be used to improve the living conditions of her family, to meet their basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods for her general store

loans.name: Carenette

texts.en: Carenette is a 27-year-old single woman living in Aguada, Ozamiz City. She has been a branch manager of an appliance store for seven years and earns 12,000 PHP a month for a living. She planned to start a printing press business, which is why she borrowed 20,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to purchase a computer to use for her business. She always dreams of being successful in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase a computer for her business

loans.name: Ena Ruth

texts.es: Doña ena de 44 años de edad tiene un negocio de venta de embutidos, pollos, huevos, etc. desde hace varios años en un mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir los gastos que tiene en su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo, doña ena esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar pollos, embutidos y huevos por mayor para poder surtir su negocio con mas productos para que sus clientes siempre estén satisfechos a la hora que le llegan a comprar y ella pueda obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor vida con su esposo.
texts.en:
Ena, age 44, has had a business selling sausages, chickens, and eggs, etc. for several years.  She sells at a market that is close to where she lives.  With the profits that she gets, she manages to cover the household expenses.  She lives in her own house with her husband.  

Ena is requesting a loan in order to be able to buy chickens, sausages, and eggs wholesale.  She will do this to be able to stock her business with more products so that her customers will always be satisfied when they come to buy.  This way she will also be able to get better profits, which will help her and her husband to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy chickens, sausages, and eggs wholesale.

loans.name: Mujeres Empresarias Group

texts.es: El grupo “MUJERES EMPRESARIAS” está conformado por 8 mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras dedicadas a diversas actividades del comercio. Hilda tiene 30 años soltera con un dependiente trabaja hace 2 años como costurera en un taller textil en sus tiempos libres vende productos de belleza gracias a la motivación de una de las socias del grupo. Años atrás trabajaba en la empresa minera Chinalco como bazarista. El préstamo lo invirtió en la compra de más en la compra de más productos de belleza. Su mayor deseo es taller su propio taller de confección de polos. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo obtenido. Hilda es la primera persona del lado izquierdo. La señora Magna no pudo estar presente en la reunión por motivos de salud.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Empresarias" group is made up of 8 hard-working, entrepreneurial women who all have businesses selling different products.  Hilda is 30 years old, single, and has one dependent.  She has been working as a seamstress in a textile workshop for two years.  In her free time, she sells beauty products thanks to the encouragement of one of her fellow group members.  In the past, Hilda used to work for the Chinalco mining company.

Hilda invested her loan in buying more beauty products.  Her biggest desire is to own her own sewing workshop where she produces polo shirts/t-shirts.  The group is grateful to Kiva lenders for their loan.

Note: Hilda is the lady on the far left of the photo.  Magna was not able to be present at the group meeting for health reasons.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es: Doña marta de 59 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora ella vive con su hija y sus dos nietos en casa propia. Hace algunos años se decidió en poner un pequeño negocio en su hogar. El negocio consiste en una pequeña tienda que con gran esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mantener a lo largo de varios años. Cuenta con mucha clientela porque siempre tiene lo que los clientes buscan. Ella  sueña con dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y sabe que la única fuente de ingresos es su pequeño negocio, por tanto no puede descuidarse de el, por lo que cada día trabaja duramente para por mantenerlo activo, Es por esta razón que se motivo en solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para poder invertir en su tiendita y abastecerla con todo tipo de  productos como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, café, golosinas, aceite, papel, detergente, y de  más productos atractivos para los clientes. Confía que de esta manera logrará cumplir su sueño.
texts.en:
Marta, age 59, is an enterprising and tenacious woman who lives with her daughter and two grandchildren in her own house.  Several years ago she decided to set up a small business in her home.  Her business is a small store, which, with great effort and dedication, she has managed to maintain through the years.

She says that she has a lot of clientele because she always has what the customers are looking for.  She dreams of giving her family a better quality of life, and she knows that the only source of income is her small business.  Therefore, she is not able to neglect it.  Each day she works hard to keep it active.

This is the reason that motivated her to request this loan from Integral.  It is to be able to invest in her small store and to stock it with all types of products like rice, beans, sugar, milk, coffee, candy, cooking oil, paper, detergent, and more products that are appealing to the customers.  She trusts that this way she will manage to fulfill her dream.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Mahyoub

texts.en:
Mahyoub is 22 years old, and is from Ramallah. He owns a small store for selling fruits and vegetables, and has his two brothers working there.

He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy fruits and vegetables, and to develop the shop space. He hopes that this loan will help him increase his sales and thus improve his family's income.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables, and develop the shop space.

loans.name: Yuder Arley

texts.es:
Yuder, de 26 años de edad, busca como ganarse la vida y generar el sustento para su hijo de cuatro años. Debido a las pocas oportunidades de empleo y a su inestabilidad económica, este hombre ha decidido convertirse en trabajador independiente y crear su propio negocio con el fin de generar ingresos, motivo por el cual, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una motocicleta, destinada a prestar el servicio de transporte de pasajeros dentro del perímetro urbano y rural de su municipio. 
Sueña con mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y garantizarles una vivienda digna.
texts.en: Yuder is 26 years old and looking for a way to earn a living and provide sustenance for his 4-year-old son. Due to a lack of employment opportunities and his economic instability, he decided to become independent and start his own business to generate income, which is why he is requesting a loan that he plans to use to buy a motorcycle to provide passenger-transportation service within the urban and rural areas of his municipality. Yuder dreams to improve his family's living conditions and ensure a dignified life.

loans.use: Compra de una motocicleta

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Edwin quien con su credikiva,compró cementos y  moldes con los cuales elaboró bloques para vender en cosntrucciones. Su credikiva le ayudó en el aumento de los inventarios y su negocio creció. El está muy agradecido y dice a sus finaciadores de Kiva: "Espero que en los próximos créditos seguir contando con Kiva" En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará materiales constructivos como cemento y nuevos moldes para incrmentar su producción y hacer de su credikiva una exitosa inversión.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Edwin who used his previous CrediKiva loan to buy a variety of women's and casual clothing as well as bags.  Now he sells a lot more because his customer base has increased.  His goal is to offer a wide variety of the articles his customers want, need or ask for.

Edwin is very grateful for the support and hopes you continue helping small businesses like his.  He is currently requesting a new loan to renovate his shop.  He will improve his corporate image and the location will be better for his customers.  This will make the CrediKiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: comprará materiales constructivos como cemento y nuevos moldes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items like beans, kejje and onions for resale.

loans.name: Rafeeq

texts.en:
Rafeeq is 39 years old, and is from Gaza. He is married and has eight children, four of whom attend elementary school.

Rafeeq has owned a grocery store since 2010. He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a display refrigerator and an electric generator for his grocery store. He hopes that this loan will increase his sales and improve his income, thus providing his children with the best life he can offer.

loans.use: to buy a display refrigerator and an electric generator for his grocery store.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela is from Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, and married with four children. Miguela prepares and sells cooked food in her community. She has been in her business for 15 years and earns 18,000 PHP per month.

In 2004, Miguela joined GDMPC to gain access to microfinance services. Miguela is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed and utensils to be used in her carenderia. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed and utensils

loans.name: Jecel

texts.en: Jecel has a sari-sari (general store) business and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She is 28 years old and lives in P-1 Cogon, Ozamiz City. She is married with three children. Jecel has a requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy canned goods, cigarettes, sacks of rice, etc. Jecel has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to be successful in her chosen business.

loans.use: to purchased canned goods, sacks of rice, and other items for resale at her store.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor es un joven soltero de 22 años quien vive en Sololá.
El se dedica a la agricultura, eligió está actividad ya que de esta manera obtiene ingresos aceptables,  para aportar a la economía familiar. Realiza esta labor porque es una fuente de trabajo y no tiene  necesidad de viajar a otro departamento.
El esta solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,500.00 para compra de fertilizantes para cultivo de papa.
Su mayor sueño es mejorar su cultivo para obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Víctor is a single young man who is 22 years of age.  He lives in Sololá.  Víctor is a farmer who chose this line of work because it enables him to generate an acceptable level of income to support his family.  He engages in this trade because it provides him a source of work and it does not require him to travel to another department.  

Víctor is requesting a loan of 3,500 GTQ to buy fertilizer for growing potatoes.  His greatest wish is to improve his crops so that he can generate more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for growing potatoes

loans.name: Dúo Jerico Group

texts.es:
DUO JERICÓ
Este duo lo forma doña Maria Olivia de 29 años de edad ella tiene 2 hijos y esta casada con don Juan quien se dedica a la electricidad, y ella vende prensa por libra, tiene ya 3 años de dedicarse a la venta de prensa ella vende ropa típica de manera ambulante y también vende comida los días lunes y miércoles por su comunidad, solicita este crédito porque quiere comprar prensa Y la otra parte lo quiere invertir en la venta de ropa típica comprando ( blusas, cortes que es lo que ella mas vende), espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
Jericho Duo

María Olivia, 29, is part of this duo.  She has two children and is married to Juan who is an electrician.  She sells newspapers by the pound and has been doing so for three years.  She also sells traditional clothing from place to place and on Mondays and Wednesdays sells food in her community.

She’s asking for this loan to because she wants to buy newspapers and use the other part of it to buy traditional clothing; she will buy blouses and skirts which is what she sells the most.  She hopes that you will be able to help with the loan requested.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing and newspapers to sell.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo es un señor de 50 años de edad, actualmente se dedica a vender productos por catálogo, ya ha formado su propia cartera de clientes, su objetivo es extenderse hacia otras comunidades y ofrecer sus productos a más personas, para  lograrlo está solicitando un crédito por un millón de colones (¢1.000.000) para comprar productos de catálogo, como cremas, perfumes, desodorantes y demás productos de cosmetología, con esto nos comenta Guillermo obtendrá mayores ingresos que beneficiará su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Guillermo is 50 years old, and he currently engages in selling product by catalogue. He has already gained his own group of customers, and he aims at expanding his activity to other communities and at offering his products to more people. In order to achieve his goal he is requesting a loan of one million colones (¢1.000.000) to buy catalogue products such as lotions, perfumes, deodorant, and makeup. Guillermo says that thanks to this he will earn a better income that will help him improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy products for his catalogue such as lotions, perfumes, deodorant, and makeup

loans.name: Jamiyankhorol

texts.en:
Jamiyankhorol, 46, lives with his wife and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their two flat brick house on a plot of land. 

Jamiyankhorol has been selling coal to local people after purchasing the coal from a mining company during winter, spring and autumn. In the summer, he sells sacks of sand and grit. His wife also sells building materials by renting a stall at a trade center.

Jamiyankhorol has recently begun making extensions to his brick house in order to create more space and comfortable living conditions, so he is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to purchase building materials, such as bricks, cement, planks, gypsum and fiberglass. As a result, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place. The renovated house will then enable the family to burn less coal, emit less smoke and then contribute to the efforts against air pollution. Jamiyankhorol is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy building materials in order to renovate his house.

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 28 femmes  a été créé depuis mai 2007.Il est composé de membres qui sont issus de la même zone.Elles ont pour activité principale le commerce.

Celle qui se trouve à l'extrémité droite sur la photo est la représentante,elle est âgée de 49 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 10 enfants.

Son activité consiste à acheter des tissus et les confectionner pour les revendre,elle dispose d'une clientéle qui se trouve même dans le village et certains dans la ville.

Avec ce financement,elle va acheter des tissus et fournitures pour augmenter sa production.

Son objectif est de subvenir à ses besoins et ceux de sa famille telle que la nourriture,la santé et scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group of 28 women has been created in May 2007. Its members live in the same residential zone. Their main business activity is retail. The woman on the far right in the photo is the group’s representative. She is 49 years old, married and the mother of 10.

Her business entails buying fabric and sewing outfits for sale. Her customers come from the same village and some from the [nearby] town. With this financing, she will buy fabrics and sewing supplies in order to increase her production. Her goal is to provide for herself and her family, covering needs such as food, healthcare and schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fabric and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Jose Omar

texts.es: jose de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, es comerciante de frutas y verduras desde hace 5 años eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para poder tener su negocio,  vende en el mercado que está cerca de su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela pues vende a buen precio sus frutas y verduras, jose solicita un préstamo para poder comprar plátanos, naranjas, papas, guineos, tomates, cebollas  y todo lo que necesita para acrecentar su negocio y así tener sus clientes satisfechos cuando lo busquen para comprarle sus productos y el podrá tener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a darle a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Jose, who is 38 years old, lives in his own home with his wife and daughter. He has been a fruit and vegetables vendor for five years, during which he has gained the necessary experience to run his own business. He sells his products at the market near his home. He has a large customer base because he sells his fruit and vegetables at a good price.

Jose is requesting a loan to purchase plantains, oranges, potatoes, bananas, tomatos, onions, and everything he needs in order to expand his business and keep his customers satisfied whenever they need to purchase products from him. This will allow him to obtain higher earnings, which will help him give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy plantains, oranges, potatoes, bananas, tomatos, onions, etc.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Don juan  se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maíz,cuando su cosceha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografia para luego comercializarla en agencias de granos basicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos,  Don juan esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos agricolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitacion.
texts.en:
Juan has worked in agriculture for a number of years now. His work has given him the ability and knowledge necessary to raise his crops, especially his principal crop, which is corn. When he harvests his crop, he stores it in granaries as shown in the photograph. He later sells it to wholesalers of basic grains located near his home. He uses the profits from selling his crops to help with his family’s expenses. He lives with his wife and three children.

Juan is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs for his crops, such as manure, seeds and fertilizers. With this loan he hopes to improve his profits and therefore help even more with his household expenses.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
This is Jessica, 20, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Alvin, a vendor, and they have a child. She and her husband manage their household as they both work hard to provide for their everyday expenses.

She sells towels like face towels, bathroom towels and hand towels. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

Jessica is requesting a loan amounting to 10,000 PHP that she will use for buying different towels such as face towels, hand towels and bathroom towels.

She hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for towels needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more wood and a cutting machine for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Doña teresa  vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos  en casa propia, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra maíz y frijol  cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarlo a las agencias de compra -venta de granos básicos, con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran cubrir los gastos de su hogar, ella solicita un crédito que le permita comprar abonos, pesticidas, herbicidas  y foliares, y poder  seguir con sus cosechas para poder obtener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor vida con su esposo.
texts.en:
Teresa lives with her husband and their three children in her own house.  She has been growing corn and beans for several years.  When her harvest is ready, she stores it in the granaries shown in the photograph.  She later sells it to the agencies that buy and sell basic grains.  With the sales from her harvests, and with her husband’s help, they manage to cover the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan, which will allow her to buy fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, and leaf insecticides.  She will do this to be able to continue with her harvests in order to be able to get better profits and to have a better life with her husband.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, and leaf insecticides.

loans.name: Khon

texts.en:
Khon, a 39-year-old mother of five living in a public gathering area of Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province, is a farmer who grows rice on a parcel of land close to her house, earning a daily net income of USD 5.00 per day. 

New to the HKL institution, Khon is requesting her first loan to buy a motorcycle so her husband can start a transportation service. She is most thankful to Kiva lenders for making it possible for her to satisfy her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals, etc.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 55 years old and lives in ZNAC, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with seven children.

To earn a living, Angelina has a business selling snacks. She earns about 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Angelina has requested a loan to purchase raw ingredients for her snacks vending business.

Angelina has been a member of PMPC for ten years. In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Maria Del Carme

texts.es: Doña Maria de 64 años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene muchos años de dedicarse a la agricultura por lo que se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en el rubro, es muy conocida en la zona y ya tiene buena clientela pues obtiene las mejores cosechas, por lo tanto comercia producto de primera calidad y a precios muy accesibles, además el servicio es inigualable cuando su cosecha esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografia, esta vez quiere aumentar la producción, pero necesita de un apoyo de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, fertilizante, abonos, etc. maria tiene referencias de tener una moral intachable, responsable y de muy buena paga, confía que podrá responder a la deuda y al mismo tiempo podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: María is 64 and lives with her partner and children.  She grows corn and beans and, having been involved in agriculture for a number of years, has gained plenty of experience in the field.  She is well-known throughout the area and now has a wide clientele because he cultivates the best crops.  As a result, she sells goods of the highest quality at very affordable prices.  Furthermore, the service she offers is second to none.  When the crops are ready, she stores them in the barns shown in the photo.  She now wants to boost his production, but she needs capital support, and so she is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan to buy seeds, fertiliser, manure, etc.  María is widely considered a person of high moral character, who is responsible and a good payer.  She is confident that she will be able to repay the debt and, at the same time, give her family a full life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertiliser, manure etc.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva is 55 years old, widowed, and has four children. She is from Poblacion 1, Clarin. To make a living, Primitiva owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to the local community. She earns 8,000 PHP a month and has been in this business for five years. 

In 2009, Primitiva joined GDMPC. She is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase canned goods, bottled products, and corn grits for resale. In the future, Primitiva plans to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, bottled products, and corn grits for resale.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
This is Analyn. The loan that she acquired helped her to buy more products for her business. It also helped in the education of her children and in their household expenditures. Analyn and her husband, George, work hard to continuously provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her children's education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Analyn dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes to always have good health. She meets up with her fellowship co-members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and products to increase her product inventory.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has two children. She owns a charcoal vending business, which she has been operating for five years. In this business, she sells charcoal, firewood, etc.

She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is lack of capital, a problem she sees resolved through this loan. 

Tabu is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy energy saving cooking stoves for sale in her business. She will use the extra income to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy energy saving cooking stoves.

loans.name: Gastone

texts.en:
Gastone lives in the MKilifi area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has three children. He owns a retail shop, a business which has been running for ten years. In this business, he sells retail stock, such as rice, sugar, flour and cooking oil.

He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group, and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are high cost of products. 

Gastone is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy retail stock, such as sugar, flour, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy retail stock, such as sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and owns a cafe, which he has been operating for six months. He employs one other person in the café.

He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group, and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are competition and the effects of changing seasons. 

Michael is applying for a loan of 26,250 Kenya shillings to add food stock, such as rice, cereals, wheat flour, cooking fat, etc. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to pay school fees for his child and improve his living standard. His dream is to open a restaurant.

loans.use: To add food stock, such as rice, cereals, wheat flour, cooking fat, etc.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
A resident of Mariakani, Kenya, Lilian is a married mother of three school-going children. She runs a food stall which has been in operation for 14 years and also has a grocery stall that sells fruits and vegetables.

Lilian was introduced to Milango by her friends and is requesting a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, flour, oil, cereals, vegetables, etc. Despite price fluctuations, Lilian believes she can save extra income to educate her children, build a permanent business premise, and open a larger cafe.

loans.use: To buy sugar, flour, oil, cereals, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en: Juvelyn is a 54-year-old living in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. To earn a living, Juvelyn owns and manages a sari sari store selling goods locally. She has been in this business for 3 years.In 2009, she became a member of GDMPC micro credit and has recently borrowed 20,000 PHP to purchase bottled products, canned goods and milk for sale. She dreams to expand her business to improve the quality of living of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bottled products, canned goods and milk

loans.name: Miriam Estela

texts.es: Doña mirian de 53 años de edad es una mujer  muy responsable y quien tiene como prioridad principal sacar adelante a su familia vive con su esposo y sus dos  hijos. Ella posee una venta de tortillas, en la cual se encarga de elaborar cada mediodía y cada noche. Su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación lugar en el cual su  hija  le ayuda a repartir las tortillas, sobre todo en los fines de semana. Mirian  desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio, ya que este le brinda ganancias muy estables, lo cual le permite sostener a su familia, es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor y cal, esto para elaborar mayor cantidad de tortillas, sobre todo los fines de semana que su demanda se incrementa debido a que muchas otras tortillerías están cerradas y asi ella pueda obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le permitan mejorar su estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Miriam, who is 53 years old, is a very responsible woman whose main priority is to provide for her family. She lives with her husband and their two children. She owns a tortilla shop, where she makes tortillas every midday and every evening. Her business is located in her home, and her daughter helps her deliver the tortillas, especially on the weekends. 

Miriam really wants to be able to improve her business, since it provides her with very steady earnings that allow her to support her family. That is why she is requesting a loan, so that she can purchase wholesale corn and lime in order to make larger quantities of tortillas, particularly on the weekends, when demand increases because many other tortilla shops are closed. This will allow her to obtain higher earnings and improve her financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale corn and lime.

loans.name: Tuimizane Group

texts.en:
Masika, 47, is a mother of 10 children, all of whom are studying. She is a dynamic entrepreneur and a member of Tuimizane Group. Her husband is a member of parliament (a congressman) in the DRC. 
She started this business six years ago with funds received from her husband. Later, she received credit from IMF Hekima. The crisis, insecurity, etc., constitute obstacles to her business. 

This new loan will be used to buy 50 pairs of shoes. In the future, she wants to build her business and educate her children. So she blesses Hekima for supporting women entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 50 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Tripona

texts.en:
Tripona is 59 years old and lives in Pobalcion, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with eight children.

To earn a living, Tripona has a business selling a variety of snacks. She earns about 3,500 PHP each month doing this type of work. Tripona has requested a loan to purchase more ingredients for her snack vending business.

Tripona has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Tripona would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has three children. She owns a grocery store, a business which has been running for two years. Purity set up the business through the capital she raised from the sale of farm produce.

She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are inflation and bad debts. 

Purity is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy grocery items, such as maize flour, rice, cooking fat, etc., for resale. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standards of her family and pay school fees for her children. She aspires to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, such as maize flour, rice, cooking fat, etc., for resale.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is 39 years old and is a housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children. 

Rehana's husband owns a spare parts shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. Presently he is interested in offering more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to the lack of expenses he finds it difficult. Therefore, Rehana has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of motorbike spare parts to sell in the market at profitable price. With the profits, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Rehana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Nael's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois qui abrite ce groupe de 14 femmes  a été crée en 2001. Il est composé de femmes ayant une bonne cohésion sociale de groupe. Leur principale activité est le petit commerce. 

Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, la représentante, Fatou est âgée de 48 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants dont une fille et un garçon. 

Avec le prêt reçu, elle achète des sacs de légumes à Thiaroye à Dakar pour les revendre dans sa ville( le choux à 5 000 frs, le manioc à 10 000 frs, le piment à 5 000 frs et les carottes à 7 500 frs) . Elle paie le transport à 10 000 frs et se ravitaille toutes les semaines.

Les bénéfices générés lui permettent de se prendre en charge pour la nourriture et paie la scolarité de son enfant avec une partie et l'autre elle renforce ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This group of 14 members is part of a Banc Villageois created in 2001.  It comprises women who are very united, socially, and within the group. Their main activity is small retail.

The group's representative, Fatou, is 48 years old.  In the photo, she is standing at the right-hand side, raising her hand.  She is married and the mother of two children, a girl and a boy.

She is using her loan to buy some bags of vegetables in Thiaroye of Dakar to resell in her town (some cabbage for 5,000 francs, cassava for 10,000 francs, pimiento for 5,000 francs and carrots for 7,500 francs).  She spends 10,000 francs for transportation and stocks up every week.

With her profits, Fatou is able to buy her own food, to pay her child's school fees, and to boost her savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables at the Thiaroye market in Dakar and resell them in her town

loans.name: Mahougnon Group

texts.fr: MAHOUGNON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Fabienne Espérencia est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo, est âgée 40 ans. Fabienne Espérencia est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Jérôme. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Fabienne Espérencia et son mari assurent ensemble les charges de la famille. Pour ce faire, Fabienne Espérencia vend des pièces détachées depuis dix huit ans dans un marché du Bénin. Fabienne Espérencia s'approvisionne au Nigéria.
