Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Fabienne Espérencia s’associe avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUGNON pour solliciter un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Mahougnon is a group of three people who live in the same district. The representative of the group, whose name is Fabienne Espérencia, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 40 years old and married to a retailer named Jérôme. The couple has five children, all at school and in their care. Fabienne Espérencia and her husband cover the various family expenses between them. In order to do this, Fabienne Espérencia has been selling spare parts in a market in Benin for the 18 years. She gets her supplies in Nigeria. With a view to boosting her business and satisfying customer demand more easily, Fabienne Espérencia has got together with the other members of the Mahougnon group to request a second loan from Alidé. The previous loan was repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Shahida Group

texts.en:
Shahida is a 31-year-old enterprising woman with many dreams to fulfill. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two children. She loves her family and claims they are her greatest strength for getting up each morning and working hard to generate an income. 

Since 2010, she has been working as a tailor. She provides stitching services in her community. Her eldest daughter also helps her in stitching up dresses. She has excellent stitching skills, and due to the money she generates, she has managed to provide a better quality of life for her family. 

Her greatest wish is to expand her business and to purchase one more sewing machine, as her number of customers is increasing day by day. However, because of having only one machine, she cannot easily cope with all the customers on time; that results in a loss of money and customers. 

Therefore, as a member of a two-person lending group, she is asking for a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to invest in the purchase of a sewing machine. This will allow her to fulfill the demands of customers more efficiently and to elevate her level of income. 

With the profit amount, she will pay the educational expenses of her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. 

NOTE: In the picture, Shahida is raising her hand.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 22 years old, and is from Gaza. He has owned a fruit and vegetable stall since 2011.

He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a balance scale and a small automobile for transporting the fruits and vegetables.

He hopes that this loan will help him lower transportation costs and thus improve his income

loans.use: to buy a balance scale and a small automobile for transporting fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Jualina

texts.en:
Juliana is a 37-year-old woman who trades in lace, scarves, Malta drinks and material. She is a married woman with three children who are in school.

She has been in this business for the past four years and is doing very well. She joined ID Ghana in 2010 through another beneficiary. She is a very dedicated individual and hardworking. 

She is applying for her seventh loan and needs 1,500 GHS (Ghana cedis) to buy more scarves, lace, material and Malta drinks to sell to her customers in the community.

loans.use: To buy more scarves, lace, material and Malta drinks to sell to customers.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a 37-year-old engine oil seller. He is married to Naomi, a 32-year-old printer. They have two children both in school.

In 2010, he needed capital to expand his business and, through a friend, he joined ID Ghana. He is very hardworking, industrious and a committed individual ready to go the extra mile. He has been doing this work for the past three years. 

This is his 6th loan and he needs 1,000 GHS to buy more to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy more engine oil to sell to customers

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 28-year-old woman living in Punjab, Pakistan with her three daughters and a son. She is a very hard working tailor who wants to expand her business. Parveen and her husband's biggest aims in life are to give a higher education to all of their children and to make each of them an independent human being in the future. But, because of financial constraints, it seems difficult for them to turn their dream into a reality. Parveen has applied for a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan for purchasing a new sewing machine so she can stitch up more dresses and satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of this loan, that she will be able to expand her business and reach her desired net income. That would enable her to provide a quality education to her daughters and son and fulfill all of their basic needs in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en:
Carlito is married with four children and he is 54 years old, residing at Tagudalo, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.

Carlito is operating a gardening business venture just to earn a living and he has been two years in this business. Each month, he earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business.

He requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to pay the costs of farm maintenance. In 2010, Carlito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. In the future, Carlito wants to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to pay the costs of farm maintenance.

loans.name: Garraya

texts.en: Garraya is 41 years old and stays alone. After losing her parents, she concentrated on her late father’s estate of cattle fattening and coffee growing. Having been marginalized for her masculine appearance, she did not have a chance to get married. She therefore capitalized on that weakness to work hard, and she has found herself successful in the community that had earlier despised her. Her accomplishments include building a permanent house and improving on the number of livestock. Due to this, some men now wish to marry her. Garraya has a dream of becoming a model farmer in her village. She also wants to train other single women to learn how to live on their own. She is now asking for 1,500,000 UGX to buy manure for her coffee plantation.

loans.use: to buy manure for her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 22 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past four years, Brenda has been working hard to manage her pharmacy, which sells drugs. 

To help expand her business, Brenda has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more drugs to sell, and it will help Brenda to generate greater profits and take care of her children and her family. Brenda hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Brenda is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to purchase more drugs to sell.

loans.name: Happy

texts.en:
Happy is 21 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past year, Happy has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Happy has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes to sell, and it will help Happy to generate greater profits and provide basic needs for her family. Happy hopes that in the future she will be able to provide a bright future for her child. 

Happy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a farmer.

Brigida is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as Fanta, Coca-cola, Sprite, fish canels, slippers, noodles, bread, water, cigarettes and biscuits. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $800.

Brigida is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She is happy with the TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) program that offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy Fanta, Coca-cola, Sprite, fish canels, slippers, noodles, bread, water, cigarettes and biscuits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Malkhom Jlg Group

texts.en:
Malkhom JLG is a group, comprised of Five (5) tribal women hailing from the hilly state of Manipur in the North-Eastern part of India.

The profile member is Kimneilhing alias Lhingcha, she is on the extreme left of the picture with her right hand raised. She is 37 years of age and a divorcee.

Her life was very miserable and she had to find a means to support her two sons who are 11 and 9. She doesn't have any source of income to give her two sons a proper and quality education, but with a little help from her brother and from her daily wages in the farm, she was able to enroll them in the local government school. After she was separated from her ex-husband she 
went to live in her brother's house and there she set up a tea stall with a little help from WSDS.

The tea stall was her primary source of income ever since she started it, and she said that her business is a full time responsibility, because of which she is not able to take another job. And she said that she has to be content with the meager income from her stall. She wishes to expand her business by attracting more customers, and for that she needs to buy more stock like tea leaves, sugar, milk and some ingredients. She is hopeful that the loan from Kiva will help her expand her tea stall.

She dreams of having a house for her own and her sons after 5 years. And she is very pleased and happy with the help she received from WSDS. She also said that WSDS has changed her life and what is now today is all because of the initiative and steps taken by WSDS. Without their support and help her life would have been very miserable and she would be helpless. 

The other group members are also doing their bit by setting up similar stall in and around the village and also by raising piglets and buying things from the wholesale market from the nearest town and selling them in the village.

All the group members are happy to learn that Kiva will be providing them the loan and they are all eagerly waiting for it.

loans.use: to expand her existing tea hotel by buying stock like, sugar, milk etc.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 31-year-old housewife who is the mother of four children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Parveen’s husband is a tailor by profession who owns a tailoring shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He is interested in purchasing a sewing machine, but the family does not have the funds for this.

Parveen is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband purchase a sewing machine. With the profit from her loan, she and her husband hope to grow his business in the future. Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: to purchase sewing machine for her husband business

loans.name: Norjamol

texts.ru:
Норжамол уже второй раз обращается за кредитом. Свой предыдущий заем она брала для приобретения минеральных удобрений и семян лука. Она получила хороший урожай лука, за счет прибыли с продажи урожая она купила дочери швейную машинку. 
Теперь Норжамол просит кредит для новой деятельности. Она хочет одновременно заняться животноводством. Норжамол планирует закупать каждый месяц по двух голов бычков, откармливать их в течение месяца и затем продавать на скотном рынке. У нее имеются все условия для разведения скота. Чтобы начать бизнес, Норжамол запрашивает кредит для закупа двух голов бычков и их корма.
texts.en:
Norjamol is applying for her second loan. She took her previous loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizer and seed onions. She got a good crop of onions and with the profit from their sale bought her daughter a sewing machine. 

Now Norjamol is asking for a loan for new activities. At the same time, she wants to raise livestock. Norjamol plans to buy two heads of cattle each month, to fatten them for a month, and then to sell at the livestock market. She has all the conditions for raising cattle. 

To start a new business, Norjamol is requesting a loan to buy two heads of cattle and their feed.

loans.use: to purchase two heads of cattle and their feed

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush is 45 years old. She lives in the village Geganush in the region of Syunik. She has a big family which consists of five members: she, her husband, two daughters (school-aged) and son. They have a big farm, and Anush’s husband helps her very much. In their farm, they have cattle and piglets; they also have a big garden, where they cultivate fruits and vegetables. They have had good success both in farming and agriculture. 

Anush has many regular customers who buy the products from her farm (milk, meat, eggs, fruits, vegetables). 

Anush has already once taken a loan from Kiva, and she has paid it back successfully. Anush decided to cooperate with Kiva again and ask for a loan in the amount of 400,000 Armenian drams for the organization of hay-gathering work and for buying fodder for her animals.

loans.use: to pay for hay-gathering work and buy fodder for her animals.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: doña maria vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hija en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo es de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden y al gusto de los clientes; doña maria es una mujer emprendedora, quiere realizar una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar todo tipo d ropa por mayor, doña maria asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Maria lives with her life partner and daughter in her own home. She works selling used clothing. She has been in business for several years and has gained lots of experience, which enables her to obtain the best profit. Her business is located in her home. She has achieved a large customer base because people know that everything is good quality, that prices are affordable, and that her customer service is unmatched: she is always helpful and attentive.

Maria is an enterprising woman and wants to make a new investment, but she doesn't have enough capital to back her up. That is why she is requesting a loan from Integral, which will allow her to purchase all types of clothing wholesale. Maria assures us that she will be able to repay the debt and is also hopeful that she will bring financial security to her household.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Maelyn

texts.en:
Maelyn, 32, is married and resides at Campo 1, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Maelyn owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this business. 

In 2012, Maelyn joined GDMPC. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase rice and corn grits for sale. She aims for future business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn grits for sale

loans.name: Olivina

texts.es: La Sra. Olivina tiene 31 años y es casada con 2 hijos que son de las edades de 7 y  5 años,  ella se dedica al comercio de quinua, su tienda se encuentra en la localidad de Batallas de la ciudad de La Paz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Olivina va a usar este préstamo de para compra por cargas de quinua para abastecerse de este producto ya que es de mucha demanda de la población por su alto valor nutricional, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incremento de capital de trabajo ya que esta época tiene mucha venta, la Sra. Olivina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia, ella va a utilizar los beneficios es seguir incrementando su mercadería, la Sra. Sra. Olivina es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Olivina, 31, is married with two children who are 7 and 5 years of age.  She’s a quinoa merchant.  Her store is located in the Batallas neighborhood in the city of La Paz.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Olivina will use it to buy loads of quinoa to stock up on this good that’s in high demand by the population because of its high nutritional value.  Her reason for requesting this loan is to increase working capital because this is a season of high demand.  The business challenge Olivina faces is competition.  She will use profits to continue increasing her merchandise.  Olivina’s a very hardworking woman who feels happy for the opportunity she’s getting by granting her a loan.

loans.use: to by quinoa.

loans.name: Dúo Cantares Group

texts.es: Dúo Cantares, este grupo esta conformado por la señora Delma Yesenia de 22 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de regalos y ropa en variedad, se a dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años, gracias a Dios su negocio a ido cresiendo considerablemente, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia en regalos y ropa nueva en diferentes diseños espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
Cantares  Duo.

Delma Yesenia, 22, is part of this group.  She sells gift items and varied clothing.  She’s been in this line of work for several years.  Thanks to God her business has been growing considerably.  She’s requesting this loan to buy more gift merchandise and new clothes in varied designs.  She hopes that you will be able to help her with the requested loan.

loans.use: to buy gift items and new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 47 years old and is married with six children. She lives in Molos, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. To earn a living, Evelyn has a business selling a variety of foods and she earns about 3,000 PHP each month. She is a new member of PMPC.

Evelyn is requesting a loan to purchase more raw ingredients to make snacks to sell. In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make snacks

loans.name: Jonibeg

texts.en:
Jonibeg is an entrepreneurial person who is married and does not have children. For the past eight years, he has been busy with animal husbandry.  Jonibeg’s animals are in good condition and, thanks to that, he has managed to win a large number of customers. He sells his animals in the local market and many of his customers are local butchers who are glad for his work. 

Jonibeg is requesting a 3,000 TJS loan to buy young cattle. He will use his loan to offer his customers good animals and continue to make financial progress and provide his household with improved earnings. Jonibeg will make his payments on time each month.

loans.use: to buy young cattle

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 34 years old and married with six children. She lives in Poblacion, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. For the past year, Marissa has sold charcoal to earn a living. She earns about 3,000 PHP each month. Marissa is a new member of PMPC.

Marissa is requesting a 3,000 PHP loan to purchase more stock of charcoal to sell. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start his bakery in town.

loans.name: Shalar

texts.en:
Shalar is 49 years old, married and the father of two children.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and lives with his wife and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Shalar is a Jabrayili refugee. His wife is a housekeeper. He has been raising cattle for the last 10 years. He says this is a very difficult job. Taking care of animals is a continuous effort.

 Shalar usually buys cattle, raises them, fattens and sells them in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 120 AZN. This is the only source of income for his family. He plans to expand the business in order to bring more funds into the family. Selling meat is a very profitable business in Azerbaijan, due to its wide use in everyday dishes. 

Shalar is applying for a loan of 1800 AZN in order to buy more calves. He believes this loan will have a positive impact on the expansion of his business. This is his third loan and he has a very good client history.

loans.use: to buy more calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a poultry house and buy chicks and feed.

loans.name: Galib

texts.en:
Galib is 55 years old, married, and has four children, three daughters and a son. His daughters go to school and university. His son goes to music school. He wants his daughters to become doctors and teachers. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income. 

Galib is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fuzuli city. Now he lives in Fuzuli region, which is close to the occupied border, with his family. 

He started his business nine years ago to makes gas and water pipes. Now Galib needs a 2,000 AZN loan to buy   equipment and spare parts. He wants to use the money from his expanded business to help his family. In the future, Galib wants to repair his workshop. This will be more profitable for his business. He is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy equipment and spare parts.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 23-year-old single man who has worked repairing electronic home appliances since 2006. His business is highly requested and he has a special talent repairing all types of washing machines, refrigerators, televisions, and other appliances. Ali also works transporting students to and from school during the autumn and winter to supplement his income and develop his social situation. He has recently started selling electronic items in addition to maintaining and repairing household appliances.

Ali is requesting a youth loan from the Kiva partner Al Majmoua to purchase electronic items for his business.

loans.use: to purchase electronics

loans.name: Rosa Eugenia

texts.es:
Rosa, solicita un nuevo préstamo porque necesita invertirá en el negocio y por la atención que la Institución le brinda; este le permitirá comprar carne, repollo, tomates, zanahorias, aceite, quesillo, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar la clientela, sus ganancias las invierte en fortalecer el negocio y los gastos básicos del hogar; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado gracias al crédito otorgado por Kiva.
texts.en:
Rosa is requesting a new loan because she needs to invest in her business and because of the attention she gets from the institution.  This one will make it possible for her to buy meat, cabbage, tomatoes, carrots, oil and string cheese, among others.

The previous loan helped her to increase her clientele.  She invests her profits in the strengthening of her business and to cover her home’s basic expenses.  Her economic conditions and family circumstances have improved thanks to the loan granted by Kiva.

loans.use: to buy meat, cabbage, tomatoes, carrots, oil and string cheese, among others.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 33-year-old hardworking housewife. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, three daughters, and two sons. Her husband has been driving a taxi for three years, and this is the only source of income for her family. 

Right now there is a lot of repairing and tuning work required in the engine of the taxi, which makes it almost impossible for him to make some earnings from it. Amina has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to meet the cost of repairing the engine of her husband's taxi so that he can drive it properly. With the profit amount, her husband would buy one more taxi in the future. 

Amina desires to provide quality education to her children and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business. She is very much thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: To meet the cost of repairing the taxi

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
Mirna, de 55 años de edad, es una mujer amable y trabajadora con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Es casada y tiene 6 hijos pero tan solo vive con uno de ellos en la casa propia que edificaron hace muchos años.Mirna se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles. Ofrece al público diversas verduras, plátanos, huevos, panes, harina, arroz, aceite, azúcar , entre otros productos en el frontis de su vivienda, ahí atiende de manera amable y muy cordial a cada uno de sus clientes. Trabaja con ayuda de su esposo y realiza esta labor desde hace 6 años. Considera rentable a su negocio pues le ha permitido salir de sus apuros económicos, así como poder apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500 soles y agradece a quienes le brindan el préstamo que requiere para seguir desarrollando su negocio, está convencida que seguirá siendo una cliente muy puntual y pagará sus cuotas a tiempo como lo hizo anteriormente.
El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de plátanos, verduras y otros productos como arroz y azúcar.
texts.en:
Mirna, 55, is a kind, hardworking woman who very much wants to get ahead.  She’s married and has six children but only one of them still lives with her in her own house they built many years ago.  Mirna works selling groceries.  She offers the public various vegetables, bananas, eggs, bread, flour, rice, oil and sugar, among other products in front of her house.  She tends to each and every one of her customers kindly and cordially there.  Her husband helps her with the work and she’s been in business for six years.  She considers her business to be profitable because it’s helped her get out of economic tight spots as well as to help her spouse with household expenses.

On this occasion she’ll ask for 500 soles and she thanks those who will fund the loan she needs to continue developing her business.  She’s convinced that she’ll continue being a very punctual client and that she will make her payments punctually like she did previously.  She will use the requested amount to buy bananas, vegetables and other products like rice and sugar.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: El Sr. Raúl tiene 20 años,  se dedica al crianza de ganado y al comercio del mismo,  comercializa sus productos en la comunidad de Batallas,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Raúl va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ganado su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que quiere  tener más ganado ya que esta época es de mucha demanda, El Sr. Raúl enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el clima el tener que transportar el ganado a los distintos puntos de venta,  pero el tiene mucha clientela por la amabilidad con la que trata a su clientela y  va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de forraje que debe comprar cada cierto tiempo para mejorar la alimentación de  su ganado,  su deseo para su negocio es tener un negocio estable y rentable y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Raúl is twenty years old. He works raising and selling cattle. He sells his products in the community of Batallas. This loan is his first cycle within our institution. Raúl is going to use this loan to purchase cattle. The reason why he is requesting this loan is that he wants to have more cattle because during this time of the year there is a lot of demand. The challenges Raúl faces in his business are the weather and having to transport the cattle to the different points of sale, but he has a large customer base because he is very attentive to his customers. He will use his profit to purchase the forage he must buy every so often to improve his cattle's nutrition. He wants his business to be stable and profitable so that he can increase his financial income.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Elya

texts.en:
Elya is 50 years old. She is married and has one schoolboy, age 12. The source of income for her family is agriculture. She raises livestock and sells milk products. She launched this business by buying one cow with a calf. Thanks to Elya’s hard work, her farm now includes three heads of cattle with their young.

To develop her business further, Elya needs to buy medicine for her animals. There is a risk to her cattle of being consumed by disease. Elya has applied for a loan in the amount of 1,200 AZN to purchase medicine, as well as to buy animal feed with the remaining balance. Elya plans to use her revenues to further increase her livestock. In the future, she plans to provide a decent education for her son.

loans.use: to purchase medicine for her livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for insurance, permits and necessary maintenance and repairs to her truck.

loans.name: Shushanik

texts.en: Shushan is a hard-working 51-year-old woman who lives in Stepanavan, a small town in the Lori region. Her first husband left her widowed, and now she is married for the second time. She has a small family, but faces many problems each day. She lives with her husband and with their handicapped daughter. Shushan and her husband are engaged in farming and sometimes she also milks her neighbours’ cows, for which she is paid. She does her work very well and accurately, so she has many loyal customers. She needs to add the to the posts of her cattle so she is requesting a loan from Kiva. She needs 400,000 Armenian drams to buy 2 young calves. She hopes for the kindness and support of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy 2 young calves

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en: Mustafa is a 32-year-old married man and a father of two kids. Besides distributing perfumes and clothes, Mustafa started making curtains and table covers at home in big quantities and works in selling them to the shops. He now wants to increase his productivity by making the party supplies made from fabric, like table and seat cloths, napkins, and curtains, to start distributing to wedding halls and hotels. For that he is applying for a loan to get more fabric and table accessories.

loans.use: to get more fabric and table accessories.

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en: Amneh is a 43-year-old married woman. She is a mother of two sons and one daughter. One of her sons is already a married man. Amneh is a tailor who works in a tailoring workshop. She started to work harder after her husband got sick and could not leave home for work. Now Amneh sells women's clothes at home after she finishes her work at the tailoring workshop. Amneh is applying for a loan today to acquire more women's clothing items to sell, and therefore increase her profits and continue supporting her family and helping provide her husband’s medications.

loans.use: to buy more women's clothing items to sell and increase her profits.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is married with nine children. She is 57 years old and lives in San Isidro, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Leonila is a farmer and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers for her garden. Leonila has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Leonila hopes to expand her garden to plant other crops.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her garden.

location.town: Liloy-San Isidro, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Arshad

texts.en:
Arshad is 33-year-old man who is the father of two children. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan. He owns a costume jewelry shop in the market that is the only source of income for his family. Arshad is interested in expanding the variety of jewelry he offers to his customers which will help to also increase his net income and savings. He does not have the capital to purchase more jewelry. 

Arshad is requesting a loan through the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a variety of costume jewelry to sell at his shop at a profitable price. With the profit from his loan he hopes to expand his business save for his children’s future. Arshad is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of costume jewelry to sell

loans.name: Fredy Odilio

texts.es:
Fredy, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por  un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de seguir invirtiendo más capital de trabajo en el cultivo de granos básicos; este le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, pesticidas, semilla de maíz, asimismo para la preparación del terreno.
El crédito anterior le ha ayudado, ya que los ingresos son mayores, las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado, espera en Dios que esta próxima cosecha le permitirá salir adelante.
texts.en:
Fredy needs to go for a new loan because he needs to continue investing more working capital in his basic grains.  This will make it possible for him to buy manure, herbicide, insecticide, fungicide, pesticide and corn seed as well as to prepare the soil.

The previous loan has helped him in that his income has increased and his economic conditions and family circumstances have improved.  He hopes to God that the next harvest will make it possible for him to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en: Huda is a 63-year-old mother of two sons. Huda uses her free time and wide social life in selling women’s bags and shawls. She has different styles of bags and different colors of shawls. Now Huda wants to add more goods like clothing items and accessories to increase her profits. For that she applied to this loan.

loans.use: to add more goods, like clothing items and accessories, to increase her profits

loans.name: Dúo Lesli Group

texts.es: DUO LESL este grupo esta integrado por las señora Ana Celia de 36 años  de edad  originaria del Municipio de San Juan,  doña Ana Celia por más de 14 años  se dedica al comercio en  su pequeño negocio el cual esta ubicado en su domicilio  una venta de consumo diario como arroz, azúcar pastas, golosinas, gaseosas,  también ha agregado la venta de perfumes, cosméticos, piñatas y regalos, ya que Gracias a Dios sus clientes ha ido aumentando es por eso que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas producto comestibles de consumo diario para la venta espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en: Ana Celia, aged 36, from the Municipality of San Juan, is a member of the Duo Lesli Group. For over 14 years, Ana Celia has been dedicated to commerce in her small business, located in her home. Daily, she sells goods such as rice, sugar, pastas, sweets, and soft drinks. Also, now she has added products such as perfumes, cosmetics, pinatas, and gifts, because, thanks to God, her customer base has grown. This is why Ana Celia is requesting a loan – to purchase more daily necessities to sell. She hopes that you can help with the loan she is soliciting.

loans.use: to purchase food products to sell.

loans.name: Timoteo Aparicio

texts.es:
Timoteo, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de más capital para seguir trabajando en el cultivo de maíz y frijol; este le permitirá comprar insumos agrícolas tales como: abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, pesticidas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a adquirir los materiales agrícolas necesarios para realizar el cultivo de granos básicos;  las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Timoteo’s asking for a new loan because he needs more capital to continue working growing corn and beans.  This one will make it possible for him to buy farm supplies like manure, herbicide, insecticide, fungicide, pesticide, etc.

The previous loan helped him get the necessary farm supplies to grow basic grains.  His economic conditions and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por  8 personas   responsables a distintas actividades comerciales  todos ellos residen en el distrito de ate Vitarte. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “santa Ana ” una de ellos es Neilly  de 32 Años de edad soltero y sin hijos, Neilly se dedica hace 5 años a la venta de desayuno  en un pequeño puesto y también genera más ingresos vendiendo almuerzo todos los días con el fin de generar más ingresos. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos  como jamonada, queso, arroz, azúcar, menestra  y así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes   y así poder salir adelante. A la vez   Neilly  y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado    y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. Neilly  es el único caballero que se encuentra en la foto,  Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en: This group is made up of 8 people. They are responsible for different commercial activities. All of them live in the district of Vitarte. They are the members of the “Santa Ana ” communal bank. One of them is Neilly. He is 32, single and has no children.  Neilly has worked for 5 years selling breakfast in a little locale. He also generates additional income selling lunches every day. With the loan, he will invest in buying more products such as ham, cheese, rice, and vegetable stew. This way, he can keep satisfying his customers' needs and get ahead.  Neilly and all of the members are grateful to Kiva for the loan and for the trust that has been put in them. Neilly is the only man in the photo. He takes his leave promising that he will achieve all of his goals.

loans.use: COMPRA DE MAS PRODUCTOS

loans.name: Mujeres En Progreso Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres en Progreso está en su Decimo Segundo ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 de las 19 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con un ingreso muy bajo, quienes se han comprometido a trabajar duro para poder crecer.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lucina, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir con ingresos muy escasos, ella se dedica a la venta ambulante de todo tipo de productos, como ser prendas artículos para la casa y demás. Ella desea que conforme pase el tiempo pueda ir mejorando su vida y sus ingresos para seguir ayudando a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas de todo tipo, como así también de artículos de mercería y artículos para el hogar.
texts.en:
The groupd called Mujeres Unidas al Progreso is in its twelfth cycle of the Comité de Mujeres program. They are all committed to working and helping each other get ahead. They have a survey project to eliminate poverty. Three of the 19 women are under the poverty line, that is, they have very low incomes. They have made a commitment to work hard to be able to get ahead.

One of the members is Lucina. In the survey she showed a level of poverty of level one, with very low income. She works as a street vendor of all types of products, such as clothing, items for the home and more. She wants to improve her life and her income over time to keep helping her family.

She is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in buying all types of clothing as well as items for the home and other merchandise.

loans.use: to buy clothing, items for the home and other merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
Las 16 integrantes de este comité cuentan con actividades variadas, cada una de ellas mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras que luchan por sus familias, para poder darles todo lo que ellos necesitan.
La Sra. Hilaria es una de las miembros, ella es una persona que emprende mucho, cuenta que se dedica a las ventas de plantas, ya que tiene un vivero con todo tipo de plantas. Cuenta que su trabajo le gusta mucho, ya que desde siempre le ha gustado mucho las plantas, por medio de ese trabajo ha podido ayudar a su familia y darles lo que necesitan para el día a día. Agradece ella por la oportunidad que sus compañeras están recibiendo ya que podrán salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de abonos, plantas, y demás insumos para poder seguir con su trabajo y dar a sus clientes lo que quieren .
texts.en:
The 16 women in this communal bank are hard-working entrepreneurs who struggle to provide for their families and give them everything they need.

Hilaria is one of the members who is very enterprising.  She has a greenhouse and sells all kind of plants, which she enjoys very much. Through her work she is able to help her family and provide for them daily.  She is grateful for this opportunity for all the members to get ahead.

The loan she is requesting is to buy fertilizer, plants and other supplies to continue in her work and satisfy her customers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, plants and other supplies.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Racquel's main source of income is through buying and selling vegetables. As a hard working mother, she wants to provide for all the needs of her children. She desires to make her business even more profitable. 

She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 50,000. If the loan is granted, she will utilize the money to buy cabbage, string beans, squash, tomatoes, eggplant and pechay.  She is very hopeful that through the loan, and with her perseverance, she will achieve all of her dreams especially for her children.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, string beans, squash, tomatoes, eggplant and pechay.

loans.name: Maria Eduviges

texts.es: doña maria vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos,su yerno y su nieta, es muy conocida en la zona donde reside por su humildad y su entrega al trabajo, nunca se ha dejado vencer y siempre ha salido adelante con sus dificultades. Con esfuerzo y dedicación posee una tienda en la que vende productos de primera necesidad granos básicos, leche, huevos, arroz entre otros, es muy dedicada a su labor y muy servicial a la hora de vender, es por eso que posee clientes que la buscan y la prefieren por sus productos. Se ha visto en la necesidad de surtir un poco mas la tienda debido al aumento de demanda y no tiene el capital para realizarlo, es por eso que doña maria solicita un crédito para comprar más productos como granos básicos producto instantáneo, golosinas, bebidas, etc. Confía en Dios de que pronto la ayuda solicitada, será otorgada, y no tendrá más preocupación que llevar el sustento diario a su hogar.
texts.en: Maria lives at a house she owns with ther two children, her son-in-law and her grandaughter.  She is well-known in the are where she lives due to her dedication to work and her humility, she has never allowed herself to give up and has always gotten through adversities. Through work and dedication she owns a store where she sells basic needs products, such as grains, milk, eggs, rice and others, she is very dedicated to her work and provides great customer services, this is why she has clients that prefer her products and go to her store.  She has the need to stock her store better because of an increase in demand and due to not having the capital to do it, she requests a loan to buy more products such as basic grains, fast food products, snacks, drinks, etc.  She is faithful that God will provide the help she needs and she won't have to worry about bringing money home for daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, fast food products, snacks, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Bobo

texts.en:
Bobo is 42 years old. He is married and has 4 children. He is a person who always has a story. Twenty years ago he went to his friend’s house and saw a big cow which nearly knocked him off his feet. He was frightened and overwhelmed. 

Returning to his home he decided to get money to purchase the animal that scared him. In this way he began own business dealing with animal husbandry. Now, he is one of the best and most successful business men in the local market. He buys cows, cares of them for 2 or 3 month and sells to local people. 

Thanks to his planning his cows are fat and attract a lot of customers. He wants to buy more cows for developing his business but he does not have the money for it. He is asking for a loan of 2000 somoni to buy cows. In this way he will provide his family with high quality of living condition. He promises to make his payment on time. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Mehvish

texts.en:
Mehvish is a young and energetic woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is 25 years old, and her husband has been operating an automobile workshop for four years. They are facing financial problems due to low monthly income.

Mehvish has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. She wants to invest in her husband’s business so that their income and savings will be increased. Her husband would primarily use the loan to buy new tools for repairing and tuning automobiles. His customer base would be increased if he had the latest equipment and tools. In the future, with the profit the loan creates, he wants to expand his workshop by adding more space to it.

Mehvish is very hopeful that this loan could solve many problems for her family, and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their help.

loans.use: To purchase workshop tools.

loans.name: Denis

texts.es: Denis, de 35 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos con quienes en su casa propia .Denis se dedica a la venta de bebidas gasificadas. Tiene instalado en su casa una refrigeradora en donde coloca todas sus bebidas para un adecuado congelamiento hasta llegar al punto máximo para refrescar la sed de sus clientes. Se inició en esta actividad hace 4 años y hasta el momento lo realiza sola. Considera a su  negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tienen sus productos influenciado por el clima caluroso de la zona.Le gusta su negocio ya que le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual solventar los gastos de su hogar y las necesidades de sus hijos, por tanto tiene planes de seguir adelante y ampliar la capacidad de productos disponibles.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 800 soles y está contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le permite avanzar con su negocio.Con el monto solicitado comprará 15 cajas de bebidas gasificadas para que siga realizando sus ventas.
texts.en: Denis, 35, is married and has two children she lives with in her own house.  Denis sells carbonated beverages.  She has a refrigerator installed at home to provide adequate maximum cooling to quench her customers’ thirst.  She started this activity four years ago and to date does it alone.  She considers her business to be quite profitable because of the demand her products have due to the hot weather in the zone.  She likes her business because it makes it possible for her to earn income to cover her household expenses and meet her children’s needs.  Therefore, she plans to continue forward and to expand the capacity of available products.  On this occasion she will request 800 soles and she’s happy to know that she has financial support that will allow her to advance in business.  She will use the requested amount to buy 15 cases of carbonated beverages to continue selling.

loans.use: to buy carbonated beverages.

loans.name: Delia Ayde

texts.es: La Sra. Delia tiene 21 años ella se dedica al comercio de quinua, su tienda se encuentra en la localidad de Batallas de la ciudad de La Paz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Delia va a usar este préstamo de para compra quinua por mayor para abastecerse de este producto ya que es de mucha demanda de la población por su alto valor nutricional, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incremento de capital de trabajo ya que esta época tiene mucha venta de este producto, además que es época de cosecha, la Sra. Delia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia, ella va a utilizar los beneficios es seguir incrementando su mercadería, la Sra. Delia es una persona joven y  muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito ya que ella está empezando en esta actividad y con el tiempo desea tener un acopio de este producto y también de trigo y otros cereales.
texts.en: Delia’s 21-years-old and works as a quinoa merchant.  Her store is located in the city of La Paz’s Batallas neighborhood.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Delia will use the loan to buy quinoa at wholesale to stock up on this product that’s in high demand by the population for its high nutritional value.  Her reason for requesting the loan is to increase working capital because this is a season when this product sells very well plus it is harvest season.  The business challenge Delia faces is competition. She will use profits to continue expanding her merchandise.  Delia’s a young, very hardworking person who feels happy for the opportunity she’s getting from the granted loan because she’s starting out in this activity and in time wants to become a deposit center for this product as well as for wheat and other cereals.

loans.use: to buy quinoa at wholesale.

loans.name: Yguazu Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  Yguazu está en su Primer Ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas tienen las ganas de trabajar juntas y ayudarse las unas a las otras. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, el cual les permite conocer la situación de cada una de ellas, donde tres de las señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lorgia quien es una de las que tiene un ingreso muy bajo, desea que a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y su esfuerzo pueda salir adelante. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza, y por medio de este trabajo está saliendo adelante y mejorando su vida y la de su familia. Trabaja por ir creciendo y ser mejor cada día.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de  mas productos de limpieza para la venta, ya que haciendo esto invierte en su plan de negocios y puede dar a su familia lo que necesitan y también mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
The group called “Yguazu” is in its first cycle in the women’s committee program.  All of them want to work together to help each other out.  They are completing the poverty elimination survey which allows them to know the situation each one of them is in; three of the women are below the poverty line.

One of the members is Lorgia who is one of the ones with very low income.  She wants to get ahead by means of effort and non-stop work.  She sells cleaning supplies and through this work is getting ahead and improving her and her family’s life.  She works in order to grow and improve every day.

She’s requesting this loan to buy more cleaning supplies to resell because by doing this she invests in her business plan and is able to give her family what they need and also to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy cleaning supplies to resell.

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras De Micaela Bastidas Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por  8   mujeres  emprendedoras   y con mucha creatividad para los negocios. Así son los integrantes del grupo comunal “MUJERES TRIUNFADORAS DE MICAELA BASTIDA”.  La Sra. Lili de 44 años de edad y con 3 hijos, la Sra. Lili  tiene una pequeño negocio de venta de ropa ya hace unos  5 años. La Sra. Lili ha llegado a fidelizar a sus clientes el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus prendas de vestir ya sea para caballero y para damas, y así  obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en ampliar su pequeño  local de venta de ropa  y así tener más variedades de ropa y seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes   y así poder salir adelante. A la vez la Sra. Lili y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. La Sra. Lili  esta parada es la primera de la parte derecha  lleva un cartera de color  negro sobre el hombro,Se despide Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
A group made up of eight enterprising woman with a lot of creativity of business, this is how the members of the “Mujeres triunfadoras de Micaela Bastida” communal bank are. 

Lili, is 44 years old and has three children. She has been running a small clothing business for five years now. Lili has managed to create customer loyalty which has generated profits to cover her household spending. In the future, she would like to have her own premises where she could sell the clothes whether for men or women and therein obtain better profits. 

With the loan, Lili will invest in expanding her small clothes business and therein have more types of clothes and continue meeting her customers' needs and in this way continue making her way ahead in life. 

At the same time, Lili and all the members of the group are grateful to Kiva for the loan given and for the confidence shown in them. Lili is seen standing and is the first person on the right, she is carrying a black bag on her shoulder. She leaves with the promise of meeting all the goals she has set down.

loans.use: to expand her small clothing store.

loans.name: Abed Al Salam

texts.en:
Abed Al Salam is a 57-year-old married man and father of two children. He has been working in furniture making since 1979. He is well known in the region for his good reputation and special talent and experience in his field. Abed Al Salam is applying for his seventh loan cycle from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary wood for a project he is working on, and to start a new business for his son, who will open a mobile selling shop that will provide the family with an additional income.

Abed Al Salam hopes to keep on improving his business and developing his family's social and financial circumstances.

loans.use: To buy necessary wood for a project he is working on, and to start a new business for his son.

loans.name: Alonso

texts.es:
Alonso, es un hombre de negocios, dedicado a su familia y a su trabajo. Desde hace cinco años creó en conjunto con su esposa una tienda dedicada a la venta de insumos para ebanistería y latonería, como medio alternativo para generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de su núcleo familiar. Asegura que el bienestar de su hijo y esposa son su principal prioridad por lo cual labora diariamente con el fin de garantizarles una mejor calidad de vida.
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido con el fin de satisfacer el nivel de demanda y aumentar la rentabilidad de su negocio.
texts.en: Alonso’s a business man who is devoted to his family and to his work.  He and his wife started a store five years ago focused on selling supplies for cabinet-making and metal-working as an alternative source of income for family support.  He states that his wife’s and his son’s wellbeing are his main priority for which he works every day in order to secure them a better quality of life.  He’s currently requesting a loan to buy stock to meet demand and to increase his business’ profitability.

loans.use: to buy cabinet-making and metal-working supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To order more drinks for his shop.

loans.name: Rehab

texts.en:
Rehab is a 52 years old conservative woman, she asked her son Mohammed to appear in the photo instead.  She has 8 children to support with the help of her husband who works in construction business.

One of her sons is Mohammed who is a 25-years-old university student majoring in Architecture. She is applying for this education loan to support her son in his studies and pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her son's semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: order more crates of soft drinks for his container.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en: Musarat is a 34-year-old energetic woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along with her husband and one child. Her husband runs a small shop located at the corner of his street. Musarat has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. The summer season has arrived, so to fulfill the demands of customers her husband would keep some cold drinks and juices in his shop. He would purchase cold drinks and juices with the loan amount and this would increase his sales and income. Musarat is very much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a 26-year-old married woman who is a mother of one child. She has been working in the beauty business from her house for six years, but today she is working hard to develop and expand her business in a well-managed way.

Manal is applying for a youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to buy a special cosmetics bed and tools, in addition to necessary facial treatments, that will improve her work and develop her skills.

Manal is a hardworker, well-known in her region for her special customer service and goodwill to expand and develop her work in a well-managed way to keep both her family and customers pleased and satisfied.

Manal hopes to be financially capable of opening her own beauty salon in the future.

loans.use: To buy necessary business needs

loans.name: Álvaro Enrique

texts.es:
Álvaro de 37 años de edad, es un guerrero, al que la vida le ha enseñado que el éxito muchas  veces no se logra en el primer intento, pero que a pesar de las circunstancias luchar es única alternativa para encontrar un mejor camino. Después de quedarse sin empleo debido a un recorte de personal en la empresa en donde laboraba, este hombre vio como la calidad de vida en su hogar desmejoraba, situación que lo motivó a subemplearse y a crear su propio negocio dedicado a la venta de postres. Hoy agradece a la vida por el inmenso regalo que le ha ofrecido, al contar con una bella familia y un negocio propio. 
Con el fin de seguir creciendo dentro del sector y ofrecer un servicio de calidad, Álvaro se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá  en la compra de un enfriador, cuatro mesas y 16 sillas, debido a que no cuenta con los recursos propios.
texts.en: Álvaro, 37, is a warrior who has learned from life that success isn’t often reached on the first attempt but that despite circumstances to fight is the only alternative that leads to a better path.  Having lost his job as a result of personnel cutbacks at the firm he was employed at, he saw how his family’s quality of life was declining.  This was a situation that motivated him to work for himself and create his own business selling desserts.  Now, he’s grateful to life for the immense gift it’s offered him in having a beautiful family and a business of his own.  Aiming at continuing to grow in the sector and to offer quality service, Álvaro is asking for a loan to buy a cooler, four tables and 16 chairs because he does not have resources of his own to do so.

loans.use: to buy a cooler, four tables and 16 chairs.

loans.name: Berenice

texts.es:
Berenice de 57 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y con deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida, Desde hace seis años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas rápidas y fritos. Labora todos los fines de semana y asegura que gracias a su negocio genera los ingresos para el sustento de su hogar. 
Con el ánimo de continuar con el desarrollo de su actividad, Berenice se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido y reparaciones al carro de comidas rápidas. Espera mejorar su nivel de ventas y gozar de una vejez digna al lado de su familia que tanto ama.
texts.en:
Berenice, 57, is an enterprising woman who very much wants to improve her quality of life.  For the last six years she’s been making and selling fast-food and fried snacks.  She works every weekend and insists that thanks to her business she generates income to support her home.

Aiming at continuing developing this activity, Berenice is asking for a loan she’ll use to buy supplies and to repair her fast-food cart.  She hopes to improve her level of sales and to enjoy a dignified old age alongside her family that she so loves.

loans.use: to buy supplies and to repair her fast-food cart.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
A sus 55 años de edad, Carmen se dedica a la venta de productos de la canasta familiar en su tienda. Labora diariamente de 8:00 a.m a 10:00 p.m. El proyecto de negocio surgió debido a que en su sector no había la prestación de dicho servicio y aprovechó la oportunidad para generar ingresos y colaborarle a su cónyuge con los gastos. 

En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido con el fin de mejorar sus ventas e introducir nuevas líneas de productos solicitados por sus clientes.
Espera seguir creciendo en el sector y gozar de mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
At the age of 55, Carmen works selling basic staple items in her store.  She works every day from 8am until 10pm.  The business project arose due to her sector’s not having said service and she took advantage of the opportunity to generate income and help her spouse with expenses.

At present, she’s asking for a loan to buy stock merchandise to improve her sales and to introduce new lines of products requested by her customers.  She hopes to continue growing in the sector and to enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy basic staple goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Jeisel

texts.es: Jeisel es una joven de 23 años de edad, soltera y madre de un niño de seis años. Trabajadora, humilde y con grandes deseos de superación. Es jefa de hogar por lo que necesita generar ingresos para satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar. Es graduada de un banco mujer, el cual no siguió con financiamiento. Ahora ella solicita un crédito individual para seguir trabajando su tierra. Tiene dos hectáreas, las cuales quiere habilitar para sembrar plátano, debido a ésto solicita un préstamo, y también para pagar la mano de obra. El ciclo productivo del plátano es de aproximadamente 9 meses, pero ella actualmente cuenta con una hectárea sembrada, la cual le va permitir hacer frente al préstamo. Su meta es mejorar las condiciones de vidad y superarse.
texts.en: Jeisel is a young 23-year-old, single mother of a six-year-old son.  She’s hardworking, humble and with a strong wish for self-improvement.  She’s a head of household which is why she needs to generate income to meet her household expenses.  She’s graduated from a women’s bank which did not continue taking out loans.   Now, she’s requesting an individual loan to continue working her land.  She has two hectares that she wants to prepare to plant bananas and because of this she’s asking for a loan; also to pay labor costs.  The productive cycle for bananas is about 9 months but she already has one hectare planted which will make it possible for her to handle the loan.  Her goal is to improve her living conditions and to improve herself.

loans.use: to buy seeds and raw materials.

loans.name: Blanca Nury

texts.es:
Blanca de 24 años de edad, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas rápidas, labor que inició debido a la necesidad de generar ingresos para costear los gastos de la educación de su hijo de 4 años. Asegura que su mayor recompensa es brindar a familia mejores condiciones de vida.
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos con el fin de aumentar sus ventas y ofrecer una mejor calidad en el servicio.
Sueña con ahorrar y adquirir su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Blanca, 24, works making and selling fast-food, work she started because she needed to generate income to cover schooling costs for her 4-year-old son.  She assures that the best reward is to provide her family with better living conditions.

She’s currently asking for a loan to buy supplies to increase her sales and offer better quality customer service.  Her dream is to save up to buy a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy staples for fast-food preparation.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en: Genalyn, 29 years old, is a married entrepreneur from Pan-ay, Clarin. She has two children and earns an income from her gardening business. She started this business almost seven years ago, and she earns 7,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month. To improve business, she is borrowing 16,000 PHP from GDMPC, which she just joined in 2011, to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Before long, she hopes to expand and use a vacant plot of land to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Camino A La Excelencia Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Camino a la Excelencia” en la comunidad de Totora (La comunidad de Totora está ubicado en el distrito de Challabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco). Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios  se dedican a la agricultura, a la venta de frutas, a la venta de comida, a la venta de comestibles, al engorde de ganado, a la ganadería, a la crianza de animales menores y otros.

Juana tiene 24 años de edad y tiene un hijo, ella es una persona responsable y amable que saca adelante a su familia, ella nació en el distrito de Challabamba pues vive en el mismo distrito donde nacio y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la agricultura pues tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, cebada, maíz y otras cosas, también ella es sus horas libres se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y pollo, ella es una persona responsable y sus vecinos no dudaron en invitarle a participar del banco comunal. En esta oportunidad Juana requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y cuyes. Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.(Las personas que aparecen en la parte inferior de la fotografía pidieron permiso para no estar presentes en la reunión)
texts.en:
A group of friends and neighbors formed the “Camino a la Excelencia” (Road to Excellence) communal bank in the community of Totora.  (The community of Totora is located in Challabamba District in Paucartambo Province in Cusco Department).  This communal bank is composed of various people who are always seeking opportunities to get ahead and by means of their daily efforts to provide a better future for their children.  The members work in agriculture, selling fruit, selling food, selling groceries, fattening up cattle, in animal husbandry and raising small farm animals, among others.

Juana, 24, has a son.  She’s a responsible, kind person who moves her family forward.  She was born in Challabamba District and still live in the district where she was born and where she carries out her economic activities.  She works in agriculture for she has several parcels of farmland where she grows potatoes, barley, corn and other things.  In her free time, she also raises small animals like guinea pigs and chickens.  She’s a responsible person and her neighbors did not hesitate to invite her to participate in the communal bank.

On this occasion, Juana needs the loan to buy seeds and guinea pigs.  The members in general appreciate the opportunity provided and commit to make their various payments according to schedule. (The people that appear on the bottom of the photo obtained permission to be in the photograph but could not make it to the reunion.)

loans.use: to buy seeds and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Raqia

texts.en:
Raqia is a 34-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has three kids, and her husband has operated an automobile workshop for the past three years. They are facing financial problems due to low monthly income.

Raqia has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. She wants to invest in her husband’s business so that their income and savings will be increased. The main purpose of the loan is for her husband to buy new tools for repairing and tuning automobiles. His customer base would be increased if he had the latest equipment and tools. In the future, with the profit he expects the loan to create, he wants to expand his workshop by adding more space to it.

Raqia is very hopeful that this loan could solve many problems for her family, and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their help.

loans.use: To purchase tools for workshop.

loans.name: Diana María

texts.es: Diana de 45 años de edad, labora en un restaurante como mesera, pero debido a su condición de madre soltera, buscó una actividad alterna con el fin de aumentar sus ingresos y garantizarles a sus dos hijos mejores condiciones de vida. Razón que la motivó a dedicarse a la venta de productos por catálogo. Asegura que ha tenido buenos resultados, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de productos al por mayor, lo que le permitirá mejorar su condición económica y garantizarles a sus hijos la oportunidad de acceder a la educación superior.
texts.en: Diana is 45 years old. She works in a restaurant as a waitress, but since she is a single mother, she began to look for a different line of work with the goal of both increasing her income and guaranteeing her two children better living conditions.  That led her to selling products by catalog. She has seen good results, which is why is she is seeking this loan, which she will invest in purchasing her products at wholesale. This will let her improve her economic situation as well as guarantee her children the opportunity for accessible higher education.

loans.use: purchase beauty and personal care products for resale.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is a 41-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Since 2002, her husband has been running a crockery business. This crockery shop is the only source of income for his family. Currently, he wants to purchase plates, spoons, glasses, cups, and mugs for his shop, to offer more variety to his customers. By doing this, he will be able to increase his net income and savings as well. 

Therefore Sughran has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan amount to increase his supply of crockery products, including plates, glasses, spoons, etc., so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Sughran hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase spoons, plates, glasses, cups, and mugs to sell.

loans.name: Dolca

texts.es: Dolca, de 48 años de edad, está casada con Edwin con quien tiene 4 hijos de 22, 17, 14 y 8 años de edad respectivamente, juntos viven en su casa propia.El trabajo de Dolca, consiste en la compra y venta de madera. Lleva en este negocio un promedio de 21 años y le esta yendo muy bien. Trabaja con ayuda de su esposo y actualmente se encuentran implementando su taller de procesamiento para que ellos mismos realicen todo el procedimiento de transformación de la madera y puedan obtener mayores ganancias.Esta muy contenta de su negocio, ya que tiene un buen margen de ganancias , además puede brindar todo lo necesario a sus hijos.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3800 soles y está agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante.Con el monto solicitado comprará madera y una sierra diamantada para que realice cortes perfectos en su pequeño taller.
texts.en:
Dolca, 48, is married to Edwin with whom she has four children who are 22, 17, 14, and 8 years of age respectively; they all live together in their her own house.  Dolca’s work is buying and selling lumber.  She’s been in this business an average of 21 years and is doing very well.  She works with her husband’s help and they are currently equipping their processing shop so that they can do all the wood to lumber transformation process themselves so their profits will be higher. 

She’s very happy with her business because it has a good profit margin and she’s able to provide everything necessary for her children.  On this occasion she will request 3,800 soles and she’s grateful for the economic support she’ll get to continue forward.  She will use the amount requested to buy lumber and a diamond blade saw so that she can make perfect cuts in her small workshop.

loans.use: to buy lumber and a diamond blade saw.

loans.name: Teressa

texts.en:
Teressa is from Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 47 years old. Teressa is married and has six children. To make a living, Teressa owns and operates a farming business. She plants and harvests bananas and vegetables for sale. Teressa has been in her business for five years and earns 4,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. 

In 2009, Teressa joined GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 19,500 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to grow. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to purchase an another lot, so that she may expand her farm.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to grow.

loans.name: Gloria Yaneth

texts.es: La señora Gloria a sus 35 años de edad es madre cabeza de familia de tres hijos de 19, 15, y 8 años de edad. Se dedica a la venta de mercancía como ropa y accesorios, pero desde hace algunos meses decidió alternar la actividad con la cría, engorde y venta de pollos y huevos, con el fin de mejorar su condición económica y garantizarles a sus hijos una buena educación. Razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de pollos y concentrado debido a la buena acogida que ha tenido en su localidad. Sueña con ampliar su galpón y convertirse en la mayor distribuidora en su región.
texts.en: Gloria, 35, is a mother of three children who are 19, 15 and 8 years of age; she’s a head of household.  She works selling merchandise like clothes and accessories but a few months ago decided to alternate this activity with raising and fattening up chicks to sell chickens and eggs aiming at improving her economic condition and guaranteeing a good education for her children.  The reason why she’s asking for a loan is to buy chicks and feed concentrate because she’s been well-received in her location.  She dreams with enlarging her coop and become the biggest supplier in her region.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed concentrate.

loans.name: Elizabete

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 3 filhos todos maiores de idade vive apenas com 1 deles, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É negociante vende produtos alimentares e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (frangos, arroz, óleo, farinha, feijão, e outros), para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja ampliar o negócio, concluir a sua casa e mobilar, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é de trabalhar mais e vencer a concorrência no mercado.
texts.en:
Elizabete is single and has three children. All of her children are adults and she lives with only one of them. She lives in a house that she owns and doesn't support anyone else.
She's a merchant who sells foodstuffs. With the current loan she intends to purchase goods (chicken, rice, cooking oil, flour, beans, etc.) in order to stock up on merchandise.
Her wish for the future is to expand her business and finish building and furnishing her house. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge she faces is working harder and beating the competition.

loans.use: to purchase goods (chicken, rice, cooking oil, flour, beans, etc.) in order to stock up on merchandise.

loans.name: Essineta

texts.pt:
Viúva e mãe de 3 filhos todos maiores de idade, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É negociante vende produtos alimentares e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (farinha, amendoim, óleo, arroz, e outros), para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja ampliar o negócio e melhorar a sua casa para melhor confortar os filhos, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é de se empenhar para tornar o seu negócio sustentável e garantir a realização de todos os seus projectos.
texts.en:
Essineta is a widow and has three children, all of whom are adults. She lives in a house that she owns and doesn't support anyone else.
She's a merchant who sells foodstuffs. With the current loan she intends to purchase goods (flour, peanuts, cooking oil, rice, etc.) in order to stock up on merchandise.
Her wish for the future is to expand her business and improve her home so that her children can have more comfort. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge she faces is working hard in order to make her business more sustainable and guarantee that all her projects will be accomplished.

loans.use: to purchase goods (flour, peanuts, cooking oil, rice, etc.) in order to stock up on merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase products (bed linens, laptops, etc.) in order to stock up on merchandise.

loans.name: María Del Socorro

texts.es:
María de 38 años de edad, se dedica al oficio de la confección desde hace más de 10 años. En la actualidad labora en un taller de confección. 
Con su visión y ganas de salir adelante, hoy se encuentra decidida a crear su propio taller, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de tres máquinas de confección con el propósito de ofrecer un servicio de calidad, mejorando su condición económica y garantizándole a su hijo de ocho meses de edad un calidad de vida digna.
