Daniry is receiving her 5th loan and she is very excited to receive it, because after taking loans from Esperanza International, she has been able to increase her sales and inventory. Her plan for the future is to have a store where she can sell these products and many others. She is very thankful for all your support.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Wilber

texts.es: Wilber  tiene la edad de 45 años, está casado y vive con la esposa y dos hijos actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de insumos y ayudarse con la mano de obra. El desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Wilber is 45 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two children.  He wants this loan to buy farm supplies and to employ laborers.  He would like to properly care for his crops so that he will enjoy better yields and therefore more income.  Wilber hopes, in the future, to be able to provide his family with a better quality of life and better financial stability.  He hopes to continue growing both as a person and as a farmer.

This is the first loan that Wilber has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not received any previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR offered him this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 41-year-old Isatu from the eastern area of Waterloo, in Freetown. She is married with five children between the ages of 8 and 19; her children are attending school. She began her business after vocational training school.  

Isatu runs a beauty salon within a busy market area; she sells hair, shampoo, conditioner, and hair cream. She has been running this business since 2006. She works at the business six days per week, ten hours a day.  Isatu says that the major problem to her salon is insufficient capital to buy equipment for the shop.

Isatu has requested a loan in order to purchase salon equipment such as a dryer, a curling pin, and a fan. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her status and educate her children up to the university level. 

In the future, she plans to open one of the biggest beauty salons in the community. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase beauty salon equipment such as a dryer, a curling pin, and a fan.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 50-year-old Isatu from the Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 5 children. Three of her children are currently attending school. In 1999, Isatu established her traditional business. She began her business because she did not go school. Instead she decided to do business. She works at the business throughout the week, 12 hours per day.  She says that her business is the only source of income she has.

Isatu requires a loan in order to purchase traditional items such as calabash (gourds), fanner (lightweight woven trays), local pots and wooden spoons. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and pay her installments. In the future, Isatu plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase traditional items such as calabash, fanner, local pots and wooden spoons.

loans.name: Azibe's Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of three partners: Azibe, Patience and Lydia. They have been together from 2012 to date. They reside in the Dansoman community. They trade in porridge (koko), jewelry and clothing, respectively.

Azibe is a 32-year-old porridge (koko) seller. She is married to Yaw, a 37-year-old trader. They are blessed with 2 children. She has been with ID Ghana for the past year and doing very well in her business.

She has been doing this business for 8 years now. She is grateful to ID Ghana for the training on savings which has motivated her to save to achieve her dream. This is her 3rd loan and she needs GHS 1,200 to buy millet, beans and sugar to enable her to prepare porridge to sell to her customers.  

The group needs a total amount of GHS 2,700 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy millet, beans and sugar to enable her to prepare porridge to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Valeska Fabiola

texts.es: Valeska es una mujer emprendedora, joven de 28 años de edad, casada, trabajo en la metodología grupal y por incrementar su negocio se le promueve a la metodología individual, su negocio es la venta de ropa, cosméticos, electrodomésticos en menor escala desde hace 6 años, de ser cliente de la institución tiene 3 años consecutivos, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa nueva como pantalón de varón, pantalón de dama, camisas de hombre, blusas de damas, DVD, planchas, licuadoras, cafeteras, ropa para niños etc.
texts.en:
Valeska is an entrepreneurial woman.  She is just 28 years old and married.  In the past, she was a member of a loan group but, in order to increase her business, she has been promoted to individual loans.  Her business is selling clothing, cosmetics and small household appliances and she has been in this business for 6 years.  She has been a client of the [microfinance] institution for 3 years running.  

Valeska will invest her loan in buying new clothing such as men's trousers, women's trousers, men's shirts, women's blouses, DVD players, irons, blenders, coffee pots, children's clothing, etc.

loans.use: to buy new clothing such as men's trousers, women's trousers, men's shirts, women's blouses, DVD players, irons, blenders, coffee pots, children's clothing, etc.

loans.name: Jaudin

texts.es: Jaudin, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 26 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa y un hijo  actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Jaudin is an entrepreneurial man.  He is 26 years old, married, and lives with his wife and son.  He requested this loan to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers and insecticide sprays because he would like to tend to his coffee crops so that they will grow well and he will be able to harvest good-quality produce. The only obstacle facing this gentleman is a lack of money with which to continue growing the business on which he relies.  This is why he is requesting a loan.

This is Jaudin's first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He has not received any previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR have offered him this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu is 40 years old and married with five children between the ages of 4 and 22. Two of her children are going to school. She runs a retail business in the eastern area of Waterloo, in Freetown; she began her business to create income for herself and her family. 

She's been in this business since 2008 and sells batteries, pens, biscuits, and drinks.  She says the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Salamatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase general stock such as batteries, pens, biscuits, and drinks. She says the extra income from this loan will help her renovate her shop to a concrete structure. 

In the future, she would like to educate her children up to the collage level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase general stock such as batteries, pens, biscuits, and drinks.

loans.name: Yabundu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 43-year-old Yabundu from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 6 children. One of her children is currently attending school. 

Yabundu runs a retail business, selling cigarettes, milk and batteries. She has been running this business since 1990. She works at the business every day from morning to night. Her other source of income comes from her small-scale farming. Her main wish is to have a good site for her farming and garden business.  

Yabundu has requested a loan in order to buy fertilizer and vegetable seeds. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her status of living and pay her installment. In the future, she plans to expand her farming business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Warah

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Warah from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 6 children between the ages of 3 years and 26 years. She began her business to empower herself and her children.

Warah runs a wood business, selling wood, charcoal and palm oil. She has been running this business since 1993. She works at the business from 7:00am until 7:00pm, every day.  She says that the main challenges to her business are the poor road network within her operation area and price inflation.

Warah has requested a loan in order to buy more local goods like wood, charcoal and palm oil for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her level of living. In the future, she plans to expand her business more. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more local goods like wood, charcoal and palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Fatmata    S

texts.en:
Fatmata is 20 years old and married with 1 child, age 3 years. She runs a wood business in Waterloo 2 Eastern area in Freetown. She started in business because she married at an early age and she is illiterate, so she has no option other than to do business. 

She's been in this business for 2 years and sells wood at her house.  She describes her major hardships as inadequate funds to run her business and transportation problems.  

Fatmata requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more wood to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business, and she wants to attend adult education school. In the future, she would like to change her business to a grocery store. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more wood to expand her business.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Meet 20-year-old Deborah from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 1 child, age 1 month.  In 2010, Deborah established her general store business. She began her business because she got married at a young age and she decided to generate income to take care of her needs. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and the high cost of transportation.

Deborah requires a loan in order to purchase cigarettes, pure water and bread to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to empower herself and increase her business. In the future, Deborah plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, pure water and bread to expand her business.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica  tiene  41  años de edad, esta casada. Ella con crédito pretende comprar  insumos como abonos, fumigantes, y a su vez ayudarse con la mano de obra. Ella piensa dar mantenimiento a las plantaciones, para que este no sufra ningún daño, y no se pierda la producción, y así con su proyecto cafetalero poder generar más ganancias para contribuir con su familia, ella no cuenta con el capital necesario para dicha compra, ni dichos contratos, ya que es de bajos recursos y no tiene como adquirir el dinero necesario para esto, por lo que el solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Angélica is 41 years old and married.  She plans to use this loan to buy farm supplies such as manure and pesticide sprays.  She will also employ laborers.  Angélica plans to care for her crops so that they grow without problems and so that she doesn't lose them.  She hopes that her coffee-growing business will enable her to make more profits for her family.  She does not have the capital needed to make these purchases and hire her workers as she has limited financial resources and has no way to acquire the money she needs.  This is why she requested a loan.

This is Angélica's first loan from FUDECOSUR.  She has not received any previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR offered her this loan with better terms and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Maisara

texts.ru: Майсара жительница Яванского района. Ей 36 лет. Она замужняя женщина с тремя детьми. В данное время ее муж находится на заработках за рубежом. Майсара домохозяйка. Несколько месяцев тому назад она прошла курсы кройки и шитья. Теперь она хотела бы работать швеей и принимать заказы у себя дома. У нее есть швейная машина, но на ней очень тяжело работать, так как она старинная. Майсара хочет преобрести новую компьютерную швейную машину и тем самым начать деятельность.
texts.en:
Maisara lives in the Yavan region of Tajikistan. She is 36 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband currently works abroad.

Maisara is a housewife. Several months ago, she took sewing courses and is now ready to work as a seamstress from home. Maisara has a sewing machine, but finds it very difficult to use as the machine is ancient. She would like to purchase a new computerized sewing machine and launch her business.

loans.use: to buy a computerized sewing machine

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 43-year-old Isatu from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 5 children between the ages of 9 years and 26 years. Three of her children attend school. She started her business for the daily survival of her family.
 
Isatu runs a food stand business, selling cooking seasonings, oil and rice. She has been running this business since 1988. She works at the business 9 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the problem of price control in the market.

She has requested a loan in order to buy food commodities like cooking seasonings, oil and rice. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, she plans to have a permanent business location. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to food commodities like cooking season, oil and rice.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Kadiatu from Waterloo, in the eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 6 children. She has two additional dependents at home.  She began this business to create a source of income to take care of her children.

Kadiatu runs a grocery business at her house. She sells eggs, cigarettes and bread. She has been running this business since 2000. She works at the business from 8:00 am to 10:00 pm.  At present, she lacks sufficient capital to run her business.

Kadiatu has requested a loan in order to purchase bags of rice, sardines, butter and soft drinks for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to have a permanent residence with her family, because at present she is sleeping in the shop room. It will also help her increase her business. In the future, she plans to build a house. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, sardines, butter and soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 1 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Valentina is the group coordinator for Mujeres Unidas (United Women) 1 and 3. This group is located in Hato Mayor, a rural area in the Dominican Republic. Valentina lives with her long-term partner and her five children in a simple home in the rural village of Hato Mayor, where the cacao harvest is one of the main economic activities.

Valentina is an excellent Esperanza client and has successfully repaid seven loans. With this loan, her 16th, she plans to buy fruit and cacao. She sells in her community and to chocolate producers. Using the proceeds from her business, Valentina has been able to purchase clothes and food for her children. She has also repaired her house. Her dream for the future is to continue to educate her children and make improvements to her house. Valentina thanks you for your support in helping her achieve her goals!

loans.use: to buy fruits and cacao.

loans.name: Baindu

texts.en:
Meet 27-year-old Baindu from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 2 and 8 years. One of her children is currently attending school. In 2010, Baindu established her general stock business. She began her business because she wants to help her family. She works at the business from 8 a.m. until 9 p.m., Morning to Friday. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Baindu requires a loan in order to purchase more items like palm oil, bags of rice, soft drinks and cooking seasoning. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and buy a piece of land. In the future, Baindu plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like palm oil, bags of rice, soft drinks and cooking seasoning

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is Sarah from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown.  She is in her late thirties and is married with 2 children between the ages of 12 and 18 years. Both of her children attend school. 

Sarah runs a wood business; she sells charcoal and wood. She has been running this business for 8 years. She works at the business 9 hours per day and 7 days per week. Sarah says that the main challenges to her business are the problem of transportation to travel with her goods and difficulty to travel during the rainy season.

Sarah has requested a loan in order to purchase charcoal and wood.  The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and educate her children. In the future, she plans to change her business to being a cotton seller. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and wood

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
This is Samuel, a 58-year-old grocer. He is married to Augustina, a 47-year-old trader. He has three children with her. He belongs to the God’s Time group located in Dansoman. He sells clothes. He joined ID in 2011.

He has been trading for the past 8 years. He gets his products from the market in large quantities and sells to his customers in and around Dansoman. He is very dedicated towards his customers.

This is his 3rd loan. He needs 1,000 GHS to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more soap, cookies, rice, and other items to sell to customers.

loans.name: La Unidad 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Carolina is the coordinator of her group La Unidad (Unit) 3 & 4. This group is located in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural town surrounded by mountains and nature. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her parents. She is a young, single woman. She is a stylist.

Carolina is excited to be taking her third loan with Kiva partner Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her beauty salon by purchasing a large quantity of beauty products and some equipment like a hair dryer and other items. She will re-invest the profits in her business. She started doing her business after she worked in a beauty salon and then decided to have her own business. For her future, she is dreaming of improving her business and selling different products. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to purchase beauty and hair products, a hair dryer, and other items for her salon.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is in her late twenties and is single with 1 child aged 5 years. She runs a retails business in Waterloo eastern area in Freetown.  She was a student, but when she lost her mother she dropped out of school.

She's been in this business since 2000 and sells charcoal, salt, cooking oil and pepper within her area.  She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of finance to run her business.

Kadiatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy food items, charcoal, salt, cooking oil and pepper. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and find a vocational training school to further her education. In the future, she would like to be a hairdresser. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy food items, charcoal, salt, cooking oil and pepper

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Kadiatu from the Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is single with 2 children between the ages of 6 and 10 years. Her children are currently attending school.

In 2008, Kadiatu established her clothing business. She began her business because she wants to empower herself.  She works at the business from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m., 7 days per week. She says that her business is doing well because out of the profit, it helps her to feed the family.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase baby clothing, cream and soap. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and change her status of living. In the future, Kadiatu plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase baby clothing, cream and soap

loans.name: Hawanatu

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Hawanatu from the Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 2 children between the ages of 5 and 12 years. She began this business because she wanted to stop sitting at home as a housewife and create a source of income to support the home.

Hawanatu runs a cosmetic business; she sells hair cream, vaseline, powder and soap. She has been running this business since 2008. She works at the business every day, moving around the community to introduce her goods.  She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Hawanatu has requested a loan in order to purchase more cosmetics like hair cream, vaseline, powder and soap. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to open a shop. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics like hair cream, vaseline, powder and soap

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en: Teodora is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy items to keep in her store such as slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta), biscuits and rice. She opened her kiosk in 2008 with her own working capital of $1,500. She is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks, biscuits and rice

loans.name: Maria Rosela

texts.en:
Maria Rosela is a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is 45 years old and she is happily married to Ricky who works as a welder. God has blessed them with loving children. Life is indeed hard but by the grace of God, they were able to raise their children well and they are helping each other in working for their family.

Maria Rosela owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community and the store is just connected to or just inside their house. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg and other single items. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price then she will sell it per piece for a higher price to earn a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passerby and the people in the community. She earns PHP 300 a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store.

Maria Rosela hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Capacitadas 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Justa is the coordinator of her group Mujeres Capacitadas (Capable Women) 1 & 2. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a northern port town whose economy is dependent on tourism. She makes her home there in a simple structure as a single mother with four children.

Justa is excited to be taking out her ninth loan with Esperanza after having fully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling chicharrones (fried pork fat) and clothing by purchasing pork, different clothes and underwear to sell. She says, thanks to her loans, she has been able to establish her business and expanded it. With every loan, she has increased her sales and inventory. She will use her profits to continue improving her house.

With her past benefits and savings, it has been possible to rebuild her house, little by little, while she continues to sell and develop her business. Justa thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy pork and various clothing items.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to stock items to keep in her store such as slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits. She opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $200. She is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks and biscuits.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en: Laura is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy items to keep in her store such as slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits. She opened her kiosk in 2006 with her own working capital of $50. She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks and biscuits

loans.name: Terrance

texts.en:
Blue Fields Services, LLC is a family-owned business owned by husband and wife Terrance and Michelle. Blue Fields Services is differentiated from his competitors because Terrance targets businesses and institutions that require a higher-than-average level of sanitation.

The couple works with daycares, assisted living centers, clinics, and others, offering commercial cleaning and providing certification regarding the levels of sanitation and bacteria by using an ATP, an energy molecule found in plants, hygiene detector.

Terrance has 14 years of experience but only two years ago decided to go into business with his wife. A loan of $5,450 from Accion Texas Inc. provides him with support to more aggressively market his concept and hire three commissioned sales representatives. 

His new dream is to expand his business and hire more employees. Visit their website www.bluefieldserv.com to learn more about Terrance and Michelle’s business.

loans.use: to market his busiiness and hire three sales representatives.

loans.name: Chhim

texts.en:
Chhim, aged 31, is married and has two children who attend school. She lives in a house that she owns in the Reussey Keo district, an area of Phnom Penh city. She's a farm worker and a merchant who sells used clothing in different places in the surrounding areas. She typically makes around USD $7 per day and uses it to support her family and provide allowances for her school-aged children. 

With the current loan, Chhim intends to purchase bundles of clothing to stock up on merchandise in order to make her business grow. She had a good credit history from the previous loan she had from HKL, and this will be her second loan. She is thankful and confident to repay the loan as scheduled so she can request more loans from HKL in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothing to stock up on merchandise.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her generate income for her family. She will use the loan to stock items to keep in her store such as slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits. She opened her kiosk in 2004 with her own working capital of $1,000. She is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future

loans.use: to buy slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks and biscuits

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida has been offered a loan in the amount of $600.00 to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy items every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee, and a refrigerator to store drinks. She has operated the business since 2013. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.
Running a business has made Brigida independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy, biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee, and a refrigerator to store drinks

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem is 44 years old and lives with her husband and five children in her own house in the Prey Chor district. Her oldest child got married and settled down with a new family. Sem works in agriculture, especially raising rice crops in her paddy fields that are close to her house. She learned this work from her parents. She started doing her own business once she got married to her husband, who is skilled in playing traditional Khmer musical instruments at wedding parties.

This loan, requested through the HKL branch office, is for the purchase of construction supplies for her kitchen. This way, Sem will be able to have her house and kitchen completely finished on time to protect the family from adverse weather conditions. With a positive outlook in life, Sem believes that the loan will definitely help her develop a better living standard.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies for her kitchen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a truck-mount carpet cleaner and make a down-payment towards a company van.

loans.name: Shahid Mahmood

texts.en:
Mr. Shahid is a 37-year-old man living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Mr. Shahid is a father of five children, and he has to support his family alone. He is a hardworking and a gentle person. He owns a chicken shop in the area. It is the only source of income for his family.

Mr. Shahid has requested a loan amount of 120,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase chicken. Last month he had a financial loss in his business. Because of that, he has insufficient money for purchasing new inventory for his butcher shop. He hopes that through this loan he can easily start his business again with better turnover. Mr. Shahid is very thankful and full of joy.

loans.use: To buy chicken for resale

loans.name: Rostalina

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 3 filhos dos quais apenas 1 frequenta a Escola e os restantes já maiores de idade, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É negociante vende produtos diversos e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (farinha, feijão, massas, refrescos, óleo, e outros), para aumentar e a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja ampliar o seu negócio adquirindo uma viatura para o transporte da mercadoria e ampliar a sua casa, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é de se empenhar mais para obter mais rendimento e garantir o bem-estar da sua família.
texts.en:
Rostalina is married and the mother of 3 children, 1 of whom goes to School and the other are already of age. She lives in a house she owns and doesn't support anyone else.

She's a trader and sells various products. With this loan she plans to buy goods (flour, beans, pastas, beverages, oil and others) to increase the quantity of her stock.

In future Rostalina hopes to expand her business by buying a vehicle to transport her products and also to expand her house. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan so as to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to work harder to obtain more income and guarantee the well-being of her family.

loans.use: buy goods (flour, beans, pastas, beverages, oil and others) to increase the quantity of her stock.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 30-year-old hardworking mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along with her husband and children. She is a very skilled woman, and she is an expert in stitching up dresses. She has been doing this tailoring work for five years. All the people in her area are very well satisfied and happy with her work. She provides her services at a very reasonable amount. That's why her work is increasing day by day.

Shamim has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. Shamim wants to expand her business by purchasing one more sewing machine. She would be able to stitch dresses more appropriately and efficiently in less time with the new sewing machine. This would increase her net income and savings. She would spend the profit amount on the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is the proud owner of Covering America LLC, which has been in business for 20 years in South Texas. He understands the ins-and-outs of running a financially healthy business and how to reduce costs for himself and offer great prices for his customers.   

With Accion Texas Inc. by his side, he was able to secure a loan to purchase equipment and build cash flow to grow his business. At this point in time, he has six contracts lined up with another four in the initial stages of negotiations.  Francisco’s expertise is laser screed, a self-propelled four wheel unit that ensures accuracy and precision in laying concrete.  The machine controls an area up to 1000 feet and guarantees a three millimeter accurate layout of concrete at each job.  “My area of business is growing and with better equipment, I get better contracts.” Francisco said.

Based in Brownsville, Texas, Francisco has the ability to work throughout the booming coast town and to work with other partners in the oilfield industry.  To secure more local contracts and grow his business in this area, Francisco worked with the Small Business Administration and Accion Texas Inc. to obtain his loan.  “With Accion, I was able to expand my business capabilities and give my employees a healthy paycheck and keep them happy.” Francisco said.  Francisco also used the loan to pay for maintenance on his machinery for continued use.

His plans are to grow at a steady rate and purchase more equipment to sustain all current operations. His target markets are small businesses and large corporations that may need subcontracting work.

loans.use: to secure more projects and pay for maintenance on his machinery for continued use

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana is a 29-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family. She is a mother of three children and a responsible and hardworking housewife. Her husband operates a business which supplies construction materials. Rehana has requested a loan for her husband from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of the loan, her husband will purchase bricks, cement, and other construction materials and then sell them for a profitable amount in the main market. By doing so, he will easily increase his net income and savings for the future. Rehana is hopeful that the loan will be productive for her husband's business. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
This is Maricel, 29. She is a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She lives with her partner, and they both work hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Maricel operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition, but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one or two people when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. Maricel's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue her business operations, she requests a 20,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy additional quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Maricel hopes to grow her business. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from her studies of the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Since Jan. 2, 1991, Patricia has been self-employed  in her hometown of Birmingham, Alabama through her business W. Preschool. 

The Christian learning institution is a place where three- and four-year-olds can prep for kindergarten. It’s a school Patricia describes as generational; the students she has taught in the past now have children she currently teaches.

Patricia began working with children in the 1980s as a social worker, but then lost her job. However, it wasn’t hard for her to get back on her feet. She was employed as a substitute teacher then as a teacher at different day care centers until she decided to open her own. “(Teaching) is my calling,” Patricia said. 

Taking her calling seriously, Patricia is strict to decide who can work with her. Today, she employs four part-time and four full-time workers.  Patricia describes her employees are life-time employees; some have worked with her until retirement. She plans to keep her preschool employed with the same familiar faces to provide a comfortable and trust-worthy learning environment.

The popularity of her preschool allows Patricia to continue accepting students. Her business has grown enough that she now needs to move from the home her preschool is housed in, to a larger facility. 

While talking to the person who completes her payroll, Patricia noticed the facility she is moving into needed a lot of work; that’s when her payroll advisor informed her about nonprofit microlender Accion Texas Inc.

She applied and was approved for a loan to help repair the new building. Patricia needed three new doors, new locks, toys for the children and funds to cover the move.

She thanked Accion for the opportunity to expand her business and for trusting her: “The loan was truly a blessing for me. Without it, I would not have been able to move so soon.” Patricia said.

loans.use: to cover three new doors, locks, toys for the children and moving costs

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Antonia to improve her business. She is married and she has five children. She has a garden where many people come to buy every day. She has been involved in business activities since 2002. She feels very comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Antonia independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future and then her husband is a farmer. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) that offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
This is Carolina. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy the grocery items that she needed in her grocery store. She also started a new business where she sells used-but-quality clothes also called 'ukay-ukay' in the Philippines. She is more focused on this business now. She also has a piggery. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 50,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of used-but-quality clothes. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and the educational expenses of her daughter. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Carolina's dream is for her new business to grow and she is hoping that her daughter will finish her studies. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it helps a lot in learning from the Bible. Before becoming a member of CCT, Carolina never opened her Bible, but she does now as it strengthens her spiritual life.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of used-but-quality clothes.

loans.name: Siek

texts.en:
Siek, aged 40, is married and lives with his wife and three school-aged children in Dongkor district of Phnom Penh. He’s a farm worker and has a position in a local market as a goldsmith, where he generates a daily income to support his living. He has skills in forming metal through filing, soldering, sawing, forging, casting, and polishing metal.

Siek is now asking for a loan from Kiva.  This is his second loan cycle and he surely knows how to use it. With the loan, he plans to buy a farm animal for his farm and he really hopes to receive good profits in this coming season.

loans.use: to buy a farm animal for his farm.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is married with one child. Flora is 38 years old and lives in Disud, SIndangan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Flora bakes and sells “bibingka” to earn a living and has had this business for five  years. She has requested a loan to buy flour, oil, and other ingredients and materials used for baking “bibingka”.

Flora has been a member of PMPC for almost 6 years. In the future, Flora hopes to establish a business in town.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, and other ingredients and materials for baking

location.town: Sindangan - Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Leotina

texts.en:
This is Leotina. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able buy more stocks of biscuits. It also helped in the education of her children. She is also selling jewelry. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 19,000 PHP, to buy additional stocks of biscuits to expand her inventory. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Leotina dreams of having a stall in the mall and hopes that her other children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and she draws strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of biscuits to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Alvaro Miguel

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Álvaro quien con su credikiva compró materias primas e insumos como harina, aceite azúcar etc. Ahora tiene un vehículo que ayuda a transportar los productos que elabora y está elaborando golosinas.  Alvaro envía un mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva : “El vivir y el trabajar diario, es el sustento de mi familia y de mis hijos;  gracias por su apoyo y la labor que realiza la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.”  En la actualidad elabora chupetas y chupos de golosinas,  lo cual  requiere  moldes en mayor cantidad, por eso está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará estas herramientas, para aumentar la producción y mejorar sustancialmente sus ingresos, esto  haría de su crédito con Kiva la mejor inversión de la temporada. .
texts.en: Thank you for supporting Álvaro who used his previous Kiva loan to buy raw materials and supplies such as flour, oil, sugar, etc.  He now has a vehicle which helps him in transporting the candies that he is currently producing.  Álvaro sends the following message to Kiva lenders: "My daily work is how I support my family and my children.  Thank you for your support and for the work done by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo".  Álvaro is currently producing lollipops.  He needs a greater quantity of molds for this work, which is why he is applying for a new Kiva loan.  He will use his loan to buy these tools so that he can increase his production and substantially improve his income.  This would make his Kiva loan the best investment of the season.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of molds

loans.name: Carolina

texts.pt:
Viúva e mãe de 6 filhos, dos quais 3 frequentam Escola e os restantes já maiores, vive na casa própria e sustenta mais uma neta que vive com ela.
É negociante criadora de frangos para revenda e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (pintos, ração, vitaminas, bebedouros, e outros), para aumentar a quantidade da sua criação. 
No futuro deseja ampliar o seu negócio para satisfazer os clientes e construir uma casa para melhor confortar a sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é se empenhar mais para cobrir a maior parte no seu distrito e realizar todos os seus projectos.
texts.en:
Carolina is a widow and the mother of 6 children, 3 of whom go to School and the rest are already of age. She lives in a house she owns and support and granddaughter who lives with her.

She's a trade and raises hens for slaughter and resale. With this loan she plans to buy goods (chicks, ration, vitamins, drinking recipients and others) to be able to increase the quantity of her production.

In future Carolina hopes to expand her business to satisfy her clients and build a house to improve her family's comfort level. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan so as to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to work harder to cover a greater portion of the district and to carry out all of her projects.

loans.use: buy goods (chicks, ration, vitamins, drinking recipients and others) to be able to increase the quantity of her production of hens for slaughter

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is married with 3 children. Luisa is 47 years old and lives in Canibungan Proper, Tudela.
Luisa sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents.
Luisa has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Luisa hopes to be able to financially support all her immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents.

loans.name: Terezinha

texts.en:
A $1000 loan is offered to Terezinha to improve her business. She is 29 years old and she has a garden where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies of vegetables. She has been involved in business activities since 2008. She feels very comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Terezinha independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María es una mujer joven de 27 años de edad con muchas fuerzas, muchos ánimos y mucha alegría en su vida. Ella está en una relación en unión libre y madre de 2 hijos el mayor de 6 años y el menor de 2 años. Ella tiene un grado de escolaridad de primaria completo el cual pudo realizar gracias a la ayuda de sus padres pero no pudo seguir estudiando por la falta de apoyo económico ya que sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos. Actual mente ella trabaja como asistente administrativa de una cooperativa maderera la cual está ubicada en la zona. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron el cultivo y siembra de café como también maíz y frijoles dichas actividades las ejerce desde hace más de 10 años y hoy en día junto a su conyugue. El terreno que ellos cultivan es propio gracias a una herencia que el suegro les dejo para poder generar un poco más de ingresos para ella y su familia el cual está ubicado a 5 minutos de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan diariamente para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos mismos que son comercializados en el mercado local y con algunos compradores que llegan a la zona.

María necesita ayuda para la compra de abono, fertilizantes para sus cultivos de café ya que esto mantendrá más seguro sus cultivos y evitara que se contamine de plagas y bichos contaminantes.   

Sus metas a corto plazo es poder comprar un pedazo más de tierra para poder cultivar más productos que ayuden a generar por medio de su venta más ingresos para su familia. Sus sueños son mejorar el estilo de vida de su familia dando la oportunidad a sus hijos de estudiar para que ellos sean mejores en la vida, con muchas oportunidades y con facilidades de poder desempeñarse en el mundo laboral ya que ellos serán los herederos del patrimonio que hoy en día ella y su esposo fortalecen.
texts.en:
María, 27, is a young and strong woman, and her life is full of energy and joy. She lives in a common-law marriage and has two children who are six and two. María finished primary school thanks to her parents’ help, but she could not continue studying because of the lack of money and her parents’ difficult economic situation. She works as an assistant for a local cooperative for the timber industry, where she was taught how to grow coffee, corn and beans. She has been growing them for more than ten years, and now her partner helps her. They own the land where they work, thanks to an inheritance that her father-in-law left them to help them have a better income. This piece of land is located five minutes away from their house and they go every day to give maintenance to the crops, which are sold in the local marketplace to some customers that come to the region.

María needs help to buy compost and fertilizers for her coffee plantations, which will ensure a healthy plantation, free from plagues and harming bugs. Her short-term goal is to be able to buy more land in order to grow more and generate more income for her family. Her dream is to improve her family’s lifestyle, giving her children the opportunity to study and be the best they can be. Also, to give them the opportunities and good conditions needed to have a good working life, considering that they will inherit the legacy that she and her husband are strengthening today.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers and other supplies for her coffee plantations.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es: Ana es una mujer emprendedora, jovial, llena de ambiciones en que su negocio crezca, tiene 35 años de edad, es acompañada tiene cinco años de tener una pulpería en su domicilio, ella misma atiende el negocio y el apoyo de un particular que le paga para hacer las compras de la pulpería en el mercado municipal, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, carne de res, carne de pollo, sopas maggi, productos lácteos, cigarros, hace, jabón de lavar, jabón de baño, cloro, champo, medicamentos populares etc.
texts.en:
Ana Patricia is an entrepreneurial woman, happy and full of ambitions to gro her business. She's 35 years old, has a partner and has had a grocery store at her home for the last five years.

She tends to the business herself with the support of one employee who she pays to buy products for the store at the municipal market. Ana Patricia will use the loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, animal meat, chicken, Maggi brand soups, dairy products, cigarrettes, laundry soap, bath soap, chlorine, shampoo, popular medicine, etc.

loans.use: buy various products for her grocery store such as rice, meat, oil, shampoo and soap

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is married with 2 children. Tessie is 36 years old and lives in Canicapan, Clarin.
Tessie sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 14,900 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents.
Tessie has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Tessie hopes to be able to financially support all her immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is married with three children. Emma is 24 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Emma operates a bakery to earn a living and  had this business for three years. Each month, she earns 30,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her bakery business.

Emma has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Emma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her bakery business

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 37-year-old, hard-working woman. She lives in Punjab, Pakistan, with her husband and 4 children. Her husband is a builder by profession. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs.

Yasmeen has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. With the help of the loan, her husband will purchase construction materials like cement, bricks, and tools. With the anticipated profits, she will pay the household expenses and save for the construction of her house. She is hopeful that the loan will be productive for her husband's business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials and tools.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is married with 2 children. Lorna is 54 years old and lives in Maribojoc, Tudela, Philippines.
Lorna is a farmer and grows corn crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers.
Lorna has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Lorna hopes to support all of her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice lives in the Litein area of Kenya, the area where Mt. Kenya University is situated. She has 4 children. Her primary income sources are milk and eggs, and she has been doing this work for 15 years.

She says that grazing cows is the most enjoyable part of farming. Her biggest challenge is providing animal feeds. One of her animals is named "Chelel."

Alice was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "Low interest rates." She was also asked what she learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, and she stated: "It gives loans with low rates."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked "How will this loan benefit your family?" Alice replied, "It will earn more income."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Alice owns a cow and poultry, but she does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any changes in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has a mosquito net but she does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is married with 2 children. Chona is 47 years old and lives in Gata Daku, Clarin.
Chona sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns PHP 1,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 3,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents.
Chona has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Chona hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents.

location.town: Tudela-Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Mind

loans.name: Jhona

texts.en:
Jhona is 61 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children. 

Jhona has a store where she sells groceries and other consumable products, and she earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase more stock for her general store, such as shampoo, toothpaste, and soap.

Jhona has been a member of PMPC for 11 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is widowed with 4 children. She is 49 years old and lives in Gata Daku, Clarin.

Lorna sells a variety of products to earn a living, and she has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns PHP 1500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 3000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents.

Lorna has been a member of PMPC for one month. In the future, she hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for her store

location.town: Tudela-Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Mind

loans.name: Eoeur's Group

texts.en: A 63 year-old mother of four children, Eoeur is a peasant from Kampong Cham province. The rest of her family depends mainly on agriculture activities, rice cropping, cassava farming, and rubber tree planting. Her current activities enable her to earn up to 28,000 KHR per day. This is the first micro loan for Eoeur’s group consisting of two female members and they are seeking the same loan amount of 500,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy rubber tree seedlings and to buy potash for cassava. She hopes that she can grow her rubber healthily so as she can get a high yield of latex and make more income in order to buy additional farmland.

loans.use: to buy rubber tree seedlings and to buy potash for cassava.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is married without children. Victoria is 52 years old and lives in Gata Daku, Clarin.
Victoria sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns PHP 1,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 3,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents.
Victoria has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Victoria hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents.

location.town: Tudela-Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Mind

loans.name: Benish Group

texts.en: Benish is 31 years old. She is a diligent and hardworking woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along with her husband and two daughters. Her husband is a government employee, and both of her children are currently studying in school. Her husband’s monthly income is not enough to meet the household expenses. They are living in a rented house, and Benish desires to have her own house as they have to pay very high rent every month. For two years, Benish has been helping her husband support the family by selling clothes. As a member of a two-person group, she has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to buy new varieties of clothes and expand her business. With the anticipated profit, she wants to pay the educational expenses of her children and save some money for the future. Benish is very hopeful that the loan will be productive for them. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support. NOTE: In the picture, Benish is raising her hand.

loans.use: To purchase new varieties of clothing

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is widowed with 5 children. She is 53 years old and lives in Dolores, Clarin, Philippines.

Cristina is a farmer, and she grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers.

Cristina has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. Her goal is to save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers

loans.name: Sarun's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Sarun is a married mother blessed with two schoolchildren and one little kid who is too young for schooling. Struggling to earn a living, she farms rice on three hectares and works for others for a fee to earn extra income. Sarun has been in her current business for 20 years, and she is able to earn up to 20,000 KHR per day.

Sarun, a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), is leading a group of three to apply for a loan. She is seeking 500,000 KHR while her joint members are applying for 1,000,000 KHR each. Sarun will spend her portion of the loan to buy potash and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that she can increase her income by making a good profit.

loans.use: To buy potash and to pay for plowing fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es:
Lilia, de 55 años de edad,está casada y tiene 3 hijos adultos con quienes vive su casa propia.El trabajo de Lilia consiste en la confección de prendas de vestir para damas caballeros y niños, ella se encarga con suma paciencia de elaborar las prendas que sus clientes le solicitan principalmente lencería femenina pero también elabora de manera particular y con frecuencia algunas prendas que ella personalmente diseña, las mismas que por su creatividad puede venderlas rápidamente. Se dedica a esta actividad más de 22 años y siempre ha trabajado sola además afirma que nunca tuvo algún reclamo por parte de sus clientes.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede plasmar en un prenda el diseño en que se inspira, la facilidad que tiene de crear algo nuevo la coloca como una de las mejores costureras de la ciudad; espera pronto construir un taller de costura mucho mas grande y destinar un espacio a la venta de sus creaciones.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella para recibir éste crédito, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado comprará materiales de costura como telas, hilos, elásticos, encajes y licra.
texts.en:
Fifty-five year old Lilia is married and has three adult children.  They still live with her, in her own home.  Lilia's work is making clothing items for men, women and children.  She takes on orders to make clothing items items for her customers.  She mainly receives order for women's underwear but she also makes other items, including, often, clothing that she herself has designed.  Given her creativity she can sell these quite quickly.  Lilia has been doing this work for over 22 years and she has always worked alone.  She also tells us that she has never received any complaints from her customers.  What Lilia likes about her work is that she can express herself through her clothing items and is inspired to make them.  Given how well she can create these clothes she has become one of the best seamstresses in town.  Lilia hopes to build a much bigger workshop very soon and to have a space to sell her creations.  On this occasion she is applying for a loan of 1000 Nuevo Soles and is grateful for this opportunity and the trust that is being put in her with this loan.  She also promises to make her monthly repayments on time.

With this loan, Lilia will buy sewing supplies such as material, thread and elastic.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies such as material, threads and elastic.

loans.name: Brayan Esteban

texts.es:
Brayan es un joven de 18 años de edad, quien sueña con tener en un futuro próximo una gran cadena de restaurantes gourmet, afirma que la gastronomía es su mayor pasión por lo cual incluye dentro de su proyecto de vida convertirse en un gran chef, sueño por el que trabajará incansablemente. 
Desde hace algunos meses se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas rápidas con el fin de generar sus propios ingresos y colaborarle a su madre con los gastos de casa. Con el fin de mejorar la calidad en el servicio Brayan se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en capacitarse en cocina express, lo que le permitirá aumentar su nivel de clientes y tener una mayor aceptación en la localidad.
texts.en:
Brayan is 18 years old and dreams of, one day soon, having his own chain of gourmet restaurants.  He tells us that food is his biggest passion and so he wants to become a great chef and is working non-stop to achieve this.

For some months Brayan has been making a living producing and selling fast-food in order to earn an income and help his mother with household costs.  In order to improve the service he offers, Brayan is applying for a loan to invest in training for working in fast food.  This will allow him to improve his number of customers and become better accepted in the area.

loans.use: to pay for training as a cook.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is married with 7 children. Angelina is 61 years old and lives in Gata Daku, Clarin.
Angelina sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns PHP 1,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 3,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents.
Angelina has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Angelina hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents.

location.town: Tudela-Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Mind

loans.name: Gloria Edilma

texts.es:
Gloria de 40 años de edad, labora en un restaurante realizando oficios varios desde hace más de cinco años. Con el propósito de brindarle  a su hija una mejor calidad de vida, Gloria se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en capacitarse en productos a base de quesos y calados con el fin de incrementar los ingresos y poder mejorar su condición económica.
Espera comercializar su nueva línea de productos dentro de los vecinos del sector.
Su mayor sueño es adquirir una vivienda propia y garantizarle a su hijo una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
Gloria is 40 years old and has worked in a restaurant performing various tasks for more than five years. Hoping to give her daughter a better life, Gloria finds herself asking for a loan which she will invest in preparing products with a cheese or 'calado' (sugary syrup) base, in order to increase her income and improve her financial situation.

She hopes to commercialise her new line of products with her neighbours in the sector.

Her biggest dream is to buy her own house and guarantee a quality education for her child.

loans.use: make her own products with a cheese or 'calado' (sugary syrup) base

loans.name: Las Palmitas  (Montecristi) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Las Palmitas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Este es un grupo de 10 mujeres y 2 hombres que hace tiempo atrás decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les ha servido de mucho ya que con los créditos han podido mejorar su nivel de vida,  la mayoría de las personas que integran este banco se dedican a realizar trabajos de artesanía más que todo productos de paja toquilla y también uno que otro al comercio en general.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Mireya, tiene 21 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene una niña de 3 años de edad. El marido es artesano.

Doña Mireya como la mayoría de personas del lugar junto a su esposo se dedica a la elaboración y venta de sombreros de paja toquilla para lo cual trabajan todos los días,  esta es una profesión que le encanta ya que sus obras además de continuar con una tradición de muchos años también sus sombreros son admirados en muchas partes del Ecuador y del mundo, aprendió esta profesión de sus padres y  estos de sus abuelos, lleva como 5 años que  se dedican  a esta actividad con la cual salen adelante. Los sombreros una vez semi terminados los entregan en Montecristi lugar donde les dan el acabado necesario para venderlos al público.

Este crédito es para comprar paja toquilla para elaborar los sombreros. Para ella este es el segundo ciclo en el banco Comunal le gusta por la ayuda que les brinda la institución.

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a su hija.

La foto pequeña es de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Palmitas” (The Little Palms) meets every 15 days in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture. The handicrafts that are produced there have been recognized on a national and international level. This place is also known for its famous Panama hats.

This group includes ten women and two men who decided to join together some time ago to form a Communal Bank. As a result, the loans they have received have helped to improve their standard of living. Most of the members of the Communal Bank are artisans who make crafts out of straw. One of the other members is in the retail trade.

One member of this group is Sra. Mireya. She is 21 years old, married, and has a three-year-old daughter. Her husband is an artisan. Like most of the people from this area, Doña Mireya and her husband make and sell Panama hats, which they do every day. She enjoys her work and it is a tradition that has continued for many years. The Panama hats are admired in many parts of Ecuador and throughout the world. Mireya learned this profession from her parents and grandparents. She has been in this line of work for five years and it has helped her move forward. The semi-finished hats that she produces are delivered to Montecristi, where the necessary final touches are added before they are sold to the public. Mireya’s loan will be used to buy straw for making the Panama hats. This is her second loan cycle with the Communal Bank and she enjoys the assistance that Fundación ESPOIR has provided. Her dream is to provide the best for her daughter.

The smaller photo shows two members who were not present at the time the main group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy straw for making Panama hats.

loans.name: Oscar Enrique

texts.es: El señor Oscar hombre humilde y trabajador, habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su familia sueña con poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, el trabaja para una empresa privada desde hace muchos años y su esposa le apoya con los gastos del hogar ya que trabaja realizando dias en casa privadas, su mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que no puede recaudar de una sola vez el dinero para comprar los materiales ya que siempre se le presentan problemas, con este nuevo credito que se le ha otorgado comprara materiales como  cemento, Arena, Bloques, Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic en conjunto a Fondos Kiva le han   brindado estos años.
texts.en:
Oscar is a humble and hardworking man who lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe together with his family. His dream is to improve their living conditions. Oscar has worked for a private company for many years and his wife contributes with her job as a housekeeper. The biggest difficulty he faces is not being able to gather the money he needs to buy the materials due to problems that arise all the time.

With this loan he has been granted, he will buy building materials, such as cement, sand and bricks. He appreciates the support that AFODENIC, together with Kiva Funds, have given him all these years.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Elvin Noel

texts.es: Elvin es un hombre de 39 años de edad, casado, es comerciante, además es albañil en una clínica privada  que trabaja por contrato y en sus tiempos libres su esposa le ayuda a la compra de reses de ganado en pie que luego los comercializa en los mataderos legales de Masaya para luego su comercialización de la carne en el mercado de Masaya  misma comunidad donde el habita, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de tres vaquillas criollas, dos vacas paridas.
texts.en:
Elvin is 39 years old and is married. He works in sales in addition to being a bricklayer who works on contract for a private company. 

During their free time, his wife helps him purchase livestock which they later sell to authorized slaughter houses in Masaya. The meat is then sold in the market in Masaya, the community where he lives.  

He will use this loan to purchase three heifers and two calved cows.

loans.use: to purchase three heifers and two calved cows.

loans.name: Ivelta

texts.es: Ivelta es una joven muy esforzada, ella desea poder empezar sus estudios universitarios, por lo que necesita de un préstamo de quinientos mil colones (500.000) para la compra de libros y del pago de la matricula universitaria. la meta de ellas es poder invertir en sus estudios  para tener un buen empleo en el futuro.
texts.en: Ivelta is a very strong young woman and wants to begin her university studies.  For this, she needs a loan for 500,000 Colons to buy books and pay tuition fees.  Ivelta's goal is to be able to invest in her studies so she can have a good job in the future.

loans.use: to buy books and pay university fees.

loans.name: Irenn

texts.en: Irenn is married and has two children. She is 38 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin. Irenn sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for two years. She earns PHP 10,000 a month from this type of work. She has applied for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy additional products to sell, including canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents. Irenn has been a member of PMPC for 11 months. In the future, Irenn hope to improve their general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell, including canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is married with 2 children. She is 36 years old and lives in Gata Daku, Clarin.

Ivy sells a variety of products to earn a living, and she has had this business for 4 years. Each month, she earns PHP 1500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 3000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents.

Ivy has been a member of PMPC for one month. In the future, she hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for her store

location.town: Tudela-Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Mind

loans.name: 064's Group

texts.en:
Suriya is a 58-year-old woman. She lives in Punjab, Pakistan, with her husband and seven children. Her husband has a bicycle repair shop. This shop is the only source of income for the family.

As a member of a three-person lending group, Suriya has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband purchase bicycle spare parts -- such as wheels, handles, tires, and tubes -- for the shop. As they have no other source of income, the help of this loan will enable her husband to continue his business. With the net profit, he hopes to open a new shop for his son. Suriya is thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To buy bicycle spare parts

loans.name: Marita

texts.en: Marita is married and has six children. Marita is 57 years old and lives in Dolores, Clarin. Marita sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for seven years. She earns PHP 5,000 a month doing this type of work. She has applied for a loan of PHP 14,900 to buy additional products, including canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents. Marita has been a member of PMPC for seven years. Marita hope to save for the future.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell, including canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents.

loans.name: Rafia

texts.en:
