Rafia is a 21-year-old, hardworking housewife. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband. Her husband has been driving a taxi for three years, and this is the only source of income for her family. 

Right now, the taxi's engine requires a lot of repair and tuning. Therefore, it’s almost impossible for her husband to earn an income. Rafia has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to pay for the costs of repairing the engine so that her husband can drive it properly. With the anticipated profits from his business, her husband hopes to buy one more taxi in the future.

Rafia desires to provide quality education to her children, and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: To pay for taxi repairs

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en: Filomena is widowed and has three children. She is 62 years old and lives in Colambutan, Bajo, Tudela, Philippines. Filomena is a farmer who grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has applied for a loan to buy additional fertilizer. Filomena has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Filomena hopes to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer for her corn farm.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en: Sumaira is a 43-year-old hard-working woman. She lives in Punjab, Pakistan with her husband and five children. All her children are in school. Their family expenditures are higher than their monthly income. Her husband owns a chicken shop, which is the only source of income for their family. Now, to make their business grow, Sumaira has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to buy chickens. This will help her husband to increase his monthly net income and savings. She is thankful to Kiva for the great help and the kindness.

loans.use: to buy chicken for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beauty products and hair products needed in his salon.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan Pablo de 30 años de edad, es un hombre emprendedor y visionario. Desde hace algunos años montó su panadería la cual administra en la actualidad. Con el fin de ampliar su portafolio de productos, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará para capacitarse en la elaboración de bizcochos y cubiertas. Espera que con esta inversión sus ventas aumenten y crezca su unidad productiva.
Su mayor sueño es seguir creciendo y convertirla en la número uno de su municipio.
texts.en:
30-year-old Juan Pablo is an entrepreneurial, forward thinker.  Some years ago he set up his own bakery which he is still running to this day.  In order to expand his product portfolio, he is requesting a loan so that he can learn how to bake and decorate cakes.  He hopes that this investment will lead to an increase in his sales and help grow his business.  

Juan Pablo's biggest dream is to continue growing his business and to make it the number one bakery in his town.

loans.use: to learn how to bake and decorate cakes

loans.name: Lilian De Jesús

texts.es:
Lilian de 54 años de edad es ama de casa desde hace 29 años y madre de dos hijos. Su esposo es quien sostiene económicamente el hogar.
Su gran pasión por la repostería la ha llevado a capacitarse en el arte de la cocina, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el que pagará el curso de bizcochos y cubiertas, Técnica que aprovechará para realizar las tortas que comercializa entre las personas de su comunidad y ayudarle a su esposo con la carga del hogar.
texts.en:
54-year-old Lilian has been a housewife for 29 years and is the mother of two children.  Her husband is the one who financially supports their household.

Lilian's great passion for making confectionery products has led her to train in the art of cookery.  She is requesting a loan to pay for a course in cake baking and decorating.  She will use the techniques she learns to make cakes which she will sell to people in her community.  This will allow her to help her husband in providing for the family.

loans.use: to pay for a course in cake baking and decorating

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma is married and has three children. Wilma is 32 years old and lives in Camanse, Sinacaban. Wilma sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for seven years. She earns PHP 2,000 a month doing this type of work. She has applied for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy additional products, including canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents. Wilma has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Wilma hope to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell, including canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda is married and has four children. Linda is 45 years old and lives in Camanse, Sinacaban. She sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for five years. She earns PHP 2,000 a month doing this type of work. She has applied for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy additional products, including canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents. Linda has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Linda hope to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell, including canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents.

loans.name: Richel

texts.en: Richel is widowed and has 10 children. Richel is 42 years old and lives in Gata Daku, Clarin. Richel sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for three years. She earns PHP 1,500 a month doing this type of work. She has applied for a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy additional products, including canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents. Richel has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Richel hope to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell, including canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents.

location.town: Tudela-Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Mind

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beauty and hair products needed in her salon.

loans.name: Chhean's Group

texts.en: Chhean, age 51, is a single lady residing in Kampong Cham province. She is a local farmer who grows rice and cassava as her main source of income. The current business earns her about 15,100 KHR per day, of which she can save 9,100 KHR after deducting expenses. This is the first microloan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for Chhean and her joint member. Each of them is seeking the same amount: 500,000 KHR. The leader of her group, Chhean will spend her portion to buy potash for her cassava and to buy farming equipment to support her cassava plantation. She hopes to plant her crop on time and gain a high yield with a good profit so that she can expand her farmland and build a new house for her family.

loans.use: To buy potash and farming equipment to support her cassava plantation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en: Sokhom is a 53-year-old farmer from Kampong Cham province. She is married and has four children, two of whom are still in school. She farms one hectare each of rice and cassava. She has been in this business for ages, and she is able to earn up to 21,300 KHR per day. She and her joint member are first-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and they are seeking loans of 1,000,000 KHR each. The leader of her group, Sokhom will spend her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees for her farmland. She dearly hopes that she can grow her cassava fruitfully and get a high yield with a high selling price so that she can buy an additional plot of farmland to grow more cash crops.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar tiene 21 años de edad, tiene estudios a nivel bachillerato, culmino la secundaria en los Yungas de La paz, culmino sus estudios con mucho esfuerzo trabajando y estudiando desde muy joven, no pudo continuar sus estudios por falta de ingresos económicos  esto lo obligo  a trabajar después de culminar la secundaria; durante unos años se mantuvo en su lugar de origen luego por razones de trabajo se traslado al Trópico de Cochabamba para iniciar un trabajo como ayudante de Topógrafo, actualmente tiene ingresos que le ayudan a mantenerse, sin embargo necesita apoyar a sus hermanos en sus estudios para esto requiere realizar otros trabajos que generen mayor ingreso, por esta razón solicita un crédito para la compra de una motocicleta, la misma trabajara en una línea de moto taxis en la misma localidad de Villa tunari, esta actividad ayudara al oscar a apoyar a su familia económicamente y completar sus estudios a nivel profesional.
texts.en:
Oscar is 21 years old and completed his high school education in Los Yungas de La Paz. He finished his studies after a great deal of effort and work from a young age. However, due to a lack of financial resources, he was obligated to find work after graduation.

Oscar remained at home for a few years before moving to Trópico de Cochabamba to start a job as a surveying assistant. He currently has income to support himself, but he also needs to help his siblings with their studies. Oscar wants to take on additional work so that he can generate more income. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can buy a motorcycle in order to get a job working as part of a motorcycle taxi fleet in the town of Villa Tunari. This job will help Oscar support his family financially and help him complete his professional studies.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Siga's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 29 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 22 décembre 2012. Il est constitué par des femmes venant du même village. Elles font comme activité du commerce. Elles entretiennent de bonnes relations au sein du banc villageois.
Ndéye âgée de 24 ans est mariée et mère de 2 enfants, un garçon et une fille. Sur la photo, elle est en position debout et a levé la main pour montrer que c'est elle la vedette dans ce groupe. Elle fait comme activité le commerce de tissus. le prêt reçu va lui permettre de poursuivre son activité commerciale. Elle acheter 12 paquets de tissus de 12 yard à 5500f l'un. elle va revendre en détail et les 6 yard lui revend à 3500f.
Avec les bénéfices, elle va réinvestir dans son commerce et entretenir aussi sa famille
texts.en:
This group of 29 women is part of the "Banc Villageois" loan association that was created December 22, 2012. It consists of women from the same village. Their business activity is retail commerce. They have good relations within the "Banc Villageois".

Ndéye is 24 years old. She is married and has two children, a boy and a girl. In the photo, she is standing and raising her hand to indicate that she is the featured member of this group.

Her business is trading fabric. Receiving the loan will enable her to sustain her commercial activity. She will buy twelve 12-yard rolls of fabric at 5,500 francs each. She will sell them retail at 3,000 francs for 6 yards.

She will reinvest the profits in her business and also support her family

loans.use: Buy 12 rolls of fabric

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is married with five children. Concepcion is 54 years old and lives in ZNAC, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Concepcion sells food for snacks to earn a living and had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business. 

Concepcion has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Concepcion hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: La Colina Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento la Colina está  compuesto por nueve  integrantes, ocho mujeres y un varón ,  la  presidenta del banco es la Sra. Virginia tiene 52 años, en la foto tercera desde la izquierda es viuda hace ya bastante tiempo,   la Sra. Virginia se dedica  a la   venta de cosméticos por catalogo, ella vende sus productos de manera ambulante, visitando domicilios y oficinas públicas y privadas de la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Virginia va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de cosmético y joyas por mayor y que se encuentran en promoción y de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Virginia va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos de belleza, la Sra. Virginia es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya que esta es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
La Colina community bank has nine members: eight women and one man.  The bank's president is Virginia.  Virginia is 52 years old and is standing third from the left in the photo.  She has been a widow for quite a long time.  Virginia's business is selling cosmetics through catalogs.  She sells her products as an itinerant street vendor, visiting homes and public and private offices in the city of Santa Cruz.

This loan is Virginia's first with the [microfinance] institution and she will use it to buy discounted cosmetics and jewelry wholesale.  This will enable her to provide her customers with a good variety of products and she will be able to increase her profits.  She is requesting this loan so that she can continue improving her business.  Virginia will use the profits that she makes to continue buying a variety of beauty products.  She is a very hard-working person who feels happy that she has been offered this opportunity as this is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and jewelry wholesale

loans.name: Suriya's Group

texts.en: Suriya is 58 years old. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a hard-working and responsible housewife with seven children. Her husband sells marble bricks which is the only source of income for the family. Suriya has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. WIth the help of the loan amount he will purchase marble bricks and sell them in the market at a profitable price. She hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase marble bricks to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is married and has six children. Her husband is a farmer. She is requesting a loan of $600 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy vegetables.

Maria runs a garden that helps her generate income for her family. She opened her garden a year ago with her own working capital of $60. She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

Maria is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin), that offers loans for poor people.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Josefa Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Esperanza.

En este lugar vive a  la señora Josefa, tiene 30 años, está casada  y de esta relación tiene dos hijos dos hijos de 8 y 7 años que estudian en la escuela. Su marido es comerciante.

Doña Josefa con esposo se dedican a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, ellos todos los días arman un pequeño puesto en el centro de la ciudad lugar donde muchos comerciantes ofrecen sus productos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00  hasta las 18h00, los días que mas ventas tienen son los fines de semana ya que en esos días son las ferias del cantón y salen muchas personas del campo a abastecerse de víveres y también comprar su mercadería. Tiene seis años que se dedican a esta actividad la cual les permite salir adelante.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace más de 15 años  y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado en todo este tiempo.
  
Su sueño es tener un local fijo y propio.
texts.en:
The city of Santa Ana is known for its gorgeous landscapes and the beautiful freshwater spas that are frequented by many tourists. It is here that the members of the Communal Bank “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) meet every 15 days.

Sra. Josefa lives in this place. She is 30 years old, married, and has two children (ages 8 and 7) who are in school. Her husband is a merchant. Doña Josefa and her husband sell clothing of all types. They manage a small vending post in the central part of the city where many merchants offer their products. Josefa works every day from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. The weekends are the days when she has the most sales because the local fairs are held at that time. Many people from the countryside are out buying provisions, but they will also stop to buy merchandise. Josefa has been in business for six years and it has allowed her to move forward.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, T-shirts, and children’s clothes. Josefa has been with the Communal Bank for more than 15 years and enjoys the assistance that she has received this entire time. Her dream is to have an established shop of her own.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, T-shirts, and children’s clothes.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es una mujer emprendedora, luchadora con mucha energía de 39 años de edad casada y de ella dependen 2 hijos los cuales ambos asisten a la primaria a diferentes grados de educación. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria no completado cursado hasta el 4 grado de educación con mucho sacrificio y con mucho trabajo ya que sus padres hicieron un esfuerzo por que ella pudiese estudiar y tener un conocimiento educativo básico. Ella se ha dedicado desde toda una vida a la agricultura y hoy en día junto a su esposo realizan la producción de café. La tierra que ella junto a su esposo trabaja la adquirieron gracias a una herencia de familiar y el otro pedazo con gran esmero y sacrificio por mucho tiempo de trabajo mismo que está ubicado a 500 metros de su casa de habitación.

Actualmente Norma solicita ayuda para compra de fertilizante, abono, para su cultivo de café ya que de esa forma ella podrá mejorar su cosecha y evitara que se contamine por la roya enfermedad que daña y destruye los cultivos de café en su totalidad de ser afectados.  

Su meta es poder dar el mantenimiento necesario a sus cultivos con la compra de estos insumos para poder obtener una buena cosecha y aprovecharla al 100%. Sus sueños como toda madre de familia es darles a sus hijos una mejor educación para que de esa forma tengan mejores oportunidades de empleo, sean personas emprendedoras y que algún día ellos puedan tener su propio negocio y mejoren su estilo y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Norma is an entrepreneurial woman who works hard and with a lot of energy.  She is 39 years old, married, and has two children who are attending elementary school.  Norma did not complete her own primary education but she did work hard to complete four years of schooling as her parents made a special effort for her to attend school and obtain a basic level of education.  She has dedicated her whole life to farming and currently grows coffee together with her husband.  Norma and her husband acquired the land that they farm through an inheritance from a family member.  They work the land with great care and sacrifice.  It is located 500 meters from their home.

Norma is currently requesting help to buy fertilizers and manure for her coffee crops.  This will enable her to improve her harvest and avoid her plants being attacked by coffee rust which damages and destroys all coffee crops if they become infected.

Norma's goal is to provide all necessary care for her crops by purchasing these supplies.  In this way, she will obtain a good harvest and take full advantage of it.  Norma's dream, in common with that of all mothers, is to provide her children with a better education so that they can benefit from better job opportunities, become entrepreneurial people and some day own their own businesses and improve their lifestyle and standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure for her coffee crops

loans.name: Fati

texts.fr: Veuve et mère de 02 enfants. Madame Fati revend des céréales depuis 1990 pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Elle revend au marché et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Son troisième crédit de WAGES lui permettra d’acheter des sacs de céréales. Elle veut avoir un magasin et revendre en gros ses produits.
texts.en:
A widow and mother of two children. Mrs. Fati has been retailing grain cereals since 1990 in order to meet her family's needs.

She sells at the market and resupplies in Lome. Her third WAGES loan will allow her to buy bags of grain.

She wants to have a store and sell her products wholesale.

loans.use: Buy bags of grain

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 50 years old and lives in Malintuboan. She is married with two children.

Rosario works in the fish industry and sells fish for living. She has been doing this for four years. She has requested a loan to purchase more fish to sell.

Rosario has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Rosario hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Yolanda María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Esperanza.

En este lugar vive la señora Yolanda, tiene 40 años, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tiene un  hijo de 19 años de edad el cual estudia en universidad y vive con ella.

Doña Yolanda para salir adelante y más aun después de la muerte de sus esposo se dedica al comercio, ella compra carne al por mayor y entrega a domicilio, la carne  la muele y luego esta carne molida la lleva a entregar a ciertos locales donde venden hamburguesas y casas particulares, su hijo le ayuda en esta labor, lleva más de 10 años en este negocio el cual le permite salir adelante a punta de su trabajo duro y honrado.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar carne para la venta. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido y cumplido.
  
Su sueño es tener un local para vender la carne en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
The city of Santa Ana is known for its gorgeous landscapes and the beautiful freshwater spas that are frequented by many tourists. It is here that the members of the Communal Bank “Nueva Esperanza” meet every 15 days.

Sra. Yolanda lives in this place. She is 40 years old and has a 19-year-old son who lives with her and is studying at the university. Her husband died several years ago. In order to move forward, Doña Yolanda started working as a merchant after the death of her husband. She buys meat wholesale and has it brought to her home. The meat is ground before being delivered to private homes and certain establishments that sell hamburgers. Her son helps her with the work. Yolanda has been in this business for more than 10 years and has been able to get ahead because of her hard and honest work.

This loan will be used to buy meat that she can sell. Yolanda has been with the Communal Bank for four loan cycles and enjoys the fact that her group is close-knit and thoughtful. Her dream is to have a shop in the central part of the city where she can sell meat.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
This is Lucia. She previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lucia's dream is to expand her business in the future. She meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners that gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es: Ingrid, tiene 35 años, es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora,esta casada y junto a él tiene 2 pequeños hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia.Ingrid se dedica a alquilar su mototaxi a un chofer diariamente por las calles de la ciudad. Al final del día recibe un pago que le permite cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Se inició en este negocio hace 4 años y sus ingresos diarios se han mantenido estables. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la panadería, pero dejó esta actividad para que pueda llevar un embarazo tranquilo. Sin embargo, no se siente tranquila estando en reposo, por ese motivo quiere instalar una bodega en su casa para complementar sus ganancias diarias que percibe por el alquiler de mototaxi.Todo lo que realiza le gusta mucho y no duda en poner su mayor esfuerzo para trabajar cada día con mucho optimismo, su gran deseo ahora es refaccionar otro  vehículo que por ahora tiene en estado de inactividad para hacerlo trabajar y complementar así su principal fuente de ingresos.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 800, está muy contenta al saber que tiene un respaldo económico para seguir avanzando con el cumplimiento de sus metas. El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de llantas y refaccionará el sistema de arrastre de su mototaxi inactivo.
texts.en: Ingrid is 35 years old and is enterprising and very hard-working.  She is married and has two young children with her husband.  They all live together in their own home.  Ingrid makes a living hiring out her mototaxi to a driver to use on the city's streets every day.  At the end of the day she receives a payment for the rental that allows her to cover household costs.  Ingrid started the business four years ago and her daily income has remained stable.  Before, she made a living making and selling bread but she left this business when she fell pregnant.  However, now Ingrid does not like not going out to work and so wants to open a small grocery store in her home so that she can add another income to the mototaxi rental.  Ingrid enjoys all the work she does and has no doubts about putting more effort in to work with a positive attitude every day.  Ingrid's big dream now is to repair another vehicle she has that is not used.  She wants it to be used for work so that she can add to her main source of income.  On this occasion, Ingrid is applying for 800 Nuevo Soles and is very happy knowing that she will have financial support so that she can continue trying to achieve her goals.  The loan will be invested in buying tyres and to repair the drive system on the mototaxi that does not currently work.

loans.use: to buy tyres and pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en: Rubina is 42 years old and a housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas, and oranges in his shop. Presently he is interested to offer more variety to his customers which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to the lack of funds he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, Rubina has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at a profitable price. With the profit amount her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Rubina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of fruit to sell.

loans.name: Dolores Maricela

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Esperanza.

En este lugar vive  la señora Dolores, tiene 40 años, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos cuatro hijos mayores de edad. Su esposo es chofer.

Doña Dolores es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y también en su casa tiene un puesto en el cual se dedica a vender queso. Trabaja todos los  días en ambas ocupaciones, en la mañana vende el queso y por las tardes  sale a vender sus productos los mismos que  deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa y quesos. Lleva seis años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó este negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro.
texts.en:
The city of Santa Ana is known for its gorgeous landscapes and the beautiful freshwater spas that are frequented by many tourists. It is here that the members of the Communal Bank “Nueva Esperanza” meet every 15 days.

Sra. Dolores lives in this place. She is 40 years old, married, and has four grown children. Her husband is a chauffeur. Doña Dolores is a housewife who is able to generate her own income, which allows her to help her husband with the household expenses. She sells clothing through catalogs, but she also has a stand at her house where she sells cheese. Dolores works every day at both jobs. She sells cheese in the morning and her other products are sold in the afternoon. Her catalog products are offered on credit and she collects payment every eight days. Dolores has been in business for one year and is doing very well.

This loan will be used to buy clothing and cheese. Dolores has been with the Communal Bank for six years and enjoys being a member because the loans were used to start her business. Her dream is to have a car.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cheese.

loans.name: Marryjo

texts.en:
Marryjo is married with one child. Marryjo  is 37 years old and lives in Canicapan, Clarin.

Marryjo sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns PHP 4000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Marryjo has been a member of PMPC for one year.  In the future, Marryjo hopes to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Neida

texts.es: Neida, tiene 44 años de edad , está casada y tiene 3 hijos de 26, 23 y 18 años de edad respectivamente con quienes vive en su casa propia.El trabajo de Neida consiste en la confección de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, se encarga con suma paciencia de elaborar las prendas que sus clientes le solicitan de manera particular y con frecuencia algunas prendas que ella misma crea. Algunas de ellas las pone a la venta en un pequeño espacio dentro de su casa. Se dedica a éste trabajo más de 15 años, siempre ha trabajado sola y afirma que nunca tuvo algún reclamo por parte de sus clientes ya que siempre ha visto la forma de complacerlos para que se vayan contentos.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede plasmar en un prenda el diseño en que se inspira, la facilidad que tiene de crear algo nuevo la coloca como una de las mejores costureras de la ciudad, se siente útil siempre; espera pronto construir un taller de costura mucho mas grande y destinar un espacio únicamente destinado a la venta de sus creaciones.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segunda de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado comprará cierta cantidad de telas, hilos, elásticos, botones, cierres y otros accesorios que necesita para confeccionar algunas prendas que pondrá a la venta.
texts.en: Neida is 44 years old and is married with three children, aged 26, 23 and 18 years old.  They live with Neida in her own home.  Neida makes a living producing clothing items for men, women and children.  She patiently sews clothing that her customers order and she often produces her own creations.  She puts some of her own works up for sale in a small space in her home.  Neida has been doing this work for over 15 years and has always worked alone.  She tells us that she has never had a complaint from a customer and that she always finds a way to please them, so that they leave happy.  What Neida likes about her work is that she can express herself through the designs that she is inspired to create.  She also likes how easy she finds it to create something new and that this has made her one of the best seamstresses in town.  Neida always feels useful and hopes to build a much bigger sewing workshop in the near future and create a space just for selling her creations.  On this occasion Neida is applying for 1500 Nuevo Soles and is very happy to know that she will have financial support to progress with her business.  She also promises, once again, to make her repayments on time.  With this loan, Neida will buy materials, threads, elastic, buttons, zips and other accessories that are necessary for making certain clothing items that she will put up for sale.

loans.use: to buy materials, elastic, threads and more.

loans.name: Teresita's Group

texts.en:
Teresita is 53 years old and lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, on the island of Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. She is married with four children and runs a snack vending business, earning approximately 1,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month. She has requested a loan in order to redeem a pawned parcel of land.

Teresita has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business. She is the leader of a two-person group and although she and the other member are borrowing money together, each of them has their own business.

loans.use: To redeem a pawned parcel of land

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny, 46 years old and a citizen of Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, is married and blessed with six children. Currently, two of her kids are still in school while the remaining are paid workers in Thailand. To strive for a living, she manages two hectares of rice farming while her husband works at a local non- profit organization in the area. She is able to earn about 38,000 KHR from the current business that she has been with for 13 years.

 This is the third micro-loan for Ny with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). After the successful past loans which she has fully paid back, she feels confident that she can support her business on time. For this cycle, she is seeking 4,000,000 KHR in order to buy two cows to work her farmland. She hopes that she can earn more income to sustain her lifestyle in a good manner.

loans.use: To buy two cows to work her farmland

loans.name: Arlene's Group

texts.en:
Arlene is 42 years old and lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Arlene is engaged in a snack vending activity and earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to  purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

Arlene has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Arlene hopes to expand her business.   Arlene is the leader of a 2-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es:
Aquilina, de 51 años de edad,es madre soltera de 3 hijos, vive a lado de ellos en su casa propia y desde ahí trabaja arduamente para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
El trabajo de Aquilina consiste en la venta de comida. Se dirige muy temprano al mercado de su barrio en busca de las verduras más frescas y las carnes más limpias con los que prepara sus potajes. A su retorno a casa empieza con la preparación de los deliciosos platillos los cuales son el deleite de sus clientes habituales. Vende guisados, caldos, sopas y asados. Trabaja en esta función todos los fines de semana y lo hace con mucho optimismo. Se inició en este trabajo hace 2 años. Eventualmente se dedica a la venta de pollos y pescados. En ambas actividades recibe el apoyo incondicional de sus hijos.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener tiempo disponible para realizar otras cosas en su hogar, le esta yendo muy bien ya que la rentabilidad que obtiene supera su inversión inicial, está en proceso de crecimiento ya que sus clientes se incrementan con el paso del tiempo, espera seguir su camino hacia el progreso ya que tiene en mente la apertura un restaurante.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500, está muy contenta al saber que tiene un respaldo económico para seguir avanzando en el cumplimiento de sus metas.Con el monto solicitado comprará ingredientes e insumos para seguir con la preparación de sus deliciosos platos como carnes, arroz, aceite, plátanos, condimentos y otros.
texts.en:
Aquilina is 51 years old.  She is a single mother of 3 children.  She lives with them in a home she owns and she arduously works from home to provide them with a better quality of life. 

Aquilina sells meals.  She goes to her neighborhood market very early in the morning to find the freshest vegetables and the cleanest meats which she uses to prepare her stews.  When she returns to her house, she begins preparing the delicious plates which her regular customers enjoy.  She sells stews, broth, soups, and grilled meats.  She does this work every weekend and she does it with great optimism.  She started her business 2 years ago.  Eventually she also started selling chicken and fish.  She has the unconditional support of her children for both activities.  What she likes best about her work is that it allows her time to do other things in her home.  The business is going very well, as the profits she makes are greater than her initial investment.  The business is growing as she gains more customers over time.   She hopes to continue progressing on this path as she has a plan to open a restaurant. 

Aquilina is requesting a loan of S/. 500.  She is very happy that she has financial support to continue making progress towards achieving her goals.  With this loan she will purchase ingredients to continue making her delicious meals, such as meat, rice, oil, bananas, condiments, etc.

loans.use: to purchase food items such as meat, rice, and oil, among others.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
Samuel tiene 53 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene un hijo. Se dedica a la agricultura desde muy pequeño; fue su padre quien le enseño. También, aprendió el oficio de albañil gracias a su padre y con unos amigos aprendió el oficio de  la carpintería. Él comenta que su padre le decía “se debe aprender de todo un poco, pues sino hay una cosa hay la otra”. Se levanta muy temprano a trabajar la agricultura porque tiene que caminar una hora para llegar al terreno en donde tiene sus cultivos, trabaja durante  7 horas para aprovechar el viaje; por la tarde se dedica a trabajar en la carpintería que esta instalad en su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 8 sacos de abono, una bolsa y media de semilla, un galón de herbicidas, tres litros de pesticidas y para pago de mano de obra para sembrar maíz. Él ya tiene el terreno listo para cultivar, pero le hacen falta los demás insumos y por falta de recursos económicos no los ha podido comprar. De esta manera espera obtener ingresos para comprar lo necesario para su hogar. Su sueño es comprar un terreno para cultivar árboles frutales, y que su hijo se gradúe en la universidad.
texts.en:
Samuel s 53 years old.  He is in a relationship and has a son.  He has worked in agriculture since he was very young.  His father taught him.  He also learned bricklaying thanks to his father and with some friends he learned carpentry.  He tells us that his father told him "you should learn a little bit about everything, because if one thing isn't available, the other is". He gets up very early for work because he has to walk an hour to get to the land where he has his crops.  He works 7 hours to make the most of the trip.  In the afternoon he works in the carpentry shop he has set up in his home.

He is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to purchase 8 sacks of fertilizer, a bag and a half of seeds, a gallon of herbicides, three liters of pesticides and to pay for laborers to plant corn.  The land is already ready to plant, but he needs the remaining supplies and due to a lack of financial resources, he has not been able to buy them.  He hopes to earn enough income to purchase necessities for his home.  His dream is to purchase land to grow fruit trees, and that his son graduates from university.

loans.use: to purchase 8 sacks of fertilizer, a bag and a half of seeds, a gallon of herbicide, 3 liters of pesticides, and to pay for laborers to plant corn.

loans.name: Laing

texts.en:
Laing, 49 years old and a mother of five children, one of whom is in school, is a local farmer who does rice farming on one hectare of land. Besides farming which is the main source of the family income, she is also a sweets seller whereas her husband is a house-builder. This business, which she has been with for ages, earns her about 27,000 KHR. 

Laing has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. To fulfill her son’s dream of pursuing a Bachelor's degree, majoring in Informatics and  Economics, she is applying for an education loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) to pay her son's tuition fee. She hopes that this loan will provide financial support for her son’s education in a timely manner so that her son can pay attention to his study and get good grades. Thereby her son can obtain a good job after graduation to support the family.

loans.use: To  pay her son's tuition fee

loans.name: Dilshad

texts.en:
Dilshad is 34 years old, a hard-working mother of four children. Her husband died six years ago and she is the sole supporter of her family. She is facing a lot of financial problems right now due to her low monthly income and large family size.

Dilshad is using her tailoring skills to generate some income for her family. She is very experienced in stitching clothes, especially dresses. She has been doing this work for six years. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her business. She wants to purchase a new sewing machine so that one of her daughters can help her in stitching clothes. In this way her production would increase. She would pay the household expenses after getting the profit.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for stitching dresses

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es: Elvis es un joven trabajador. tiene mas de cinco años de estar trabajando con ganado de leche. necesita de un préstamo de un millón de colones(1.000.000) para la compra de dos vacas para producir leche. para el es bueno contar con acceso a créditos dentro de su comunidad, lo cual le facilita el acceso y mejora su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elvis is a young worker. He has been working with dairy cows for over five years.  

He needs a loan of one million Colones (1,000,000) in order to purchase two cows to produce milk. It is good for Elvis that he has access to loans within his community as it facilitates access to funding to locally and leads to improvements in his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cows for the production of dairy products

loans.name: Rous

texts.en:
Rous is 42, married, and has five children. She is a very smart and hardworking housewife, who takes responsibility for most of the non-financial matters in her household, such as maintaining the home and caring for the children. Her husband is the main income provider and he usually works at construction sites to earn income to support the family. 

Rous has saved some money so she can buy a motorcycle for the household, but she doesn't have enough. Thus, she is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 US dollars. She really needs this motorcycle to assist her husband and two employed children in commuting to their workplaces. She awaits the kind assistance of Kiva lenders and thanks them in advance.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Perlas Del Sur Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento PERLAS DEL SUR, Está  compuesto por diez integrantes todas mujeres,   la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Zaida tiene 42  años dos hijos de las edades de 9 y 12 años,  se dedica a la venta de perfumes y colonias y cosméticos por catalogo,  es promotora de productos de belleza ella vende de manera ambulante visitando instituciones públicas y privadas, barrios distintos domicilios ofreciendo sus productos, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Zaida va a usar este préstamo  para comprar perfumes y colonia por mayor que se encuentran en promoción para tener en stock para su  negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es tener variedad de productos para  satisfacer a sus  clientes, la Sra. Zaida enfrenta retos en su negocio que son atender  con eficiencia a sus clientes y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y salir adelante  sola, la Sra. Zaida se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella y a sus compañeras de grupo ya que en muchos caso al igual que ella sacan adelante a su familia.
texts.en: The “Perlas Del Sur” [Pearls of the South] Communal Bank is comprised of ten members, all women.  Zaida is the bank’s president.  She is 42 years old and has two children, ages 9 and 12.  She is engaged in selling perfume, cologne, and cosmetics by catalog. She sells her beauty products door-to-door, visiting public and private establishments, and various homes in the neighborhood.  This loan is her first sequence with the institution.  Zaida will use the funds to purchase wholesale perfume and cologne on promotion in order to stock her business.  Her reason for requesting this loan is to have a variety of products to satisfy customer demand.  The challenge that she faces in her business is providing efficient customer service.  She will use the benefits to improve the quality of life for her family as this is the only activity that permits her to support herself and succeed on her own.  Zaida is happy and grateful to the institution for the support offered to her and her companions from the group because in many cases, like hers, they help the families get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale perfume and cologne on promotion.

loans.name: Musarrat

texts.en:
Musarrat is a 40-year-old woman living in Pakistan with her husband and five children. Her husband owns a scrap shop which is the only source of income for his family. Her husband's income is not sufficient to cover household expenditures. Presently he wants to purchase damaged iron, plastic, and nylon for reselling at a profitable price.

For that reason, Musarrat has requested a loan from KIVA's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to purchase the needed things, so that he can work more professionally and efficiently and can more easily grow his business. Musarrat has dreams for her children's better future and her husband's good health. She wants to live a good and simple life with her family. Salam and many thanks from her to all Kiva lenders and BRAC and Kiva staff.

loans.use: To buy damaged iron, plastic, and nylon for reselling.

loans.name: Hot's Group

texts.en:
Hot, 55, is a resident from Kampong Cham province and a father of six children. Currently, he needs to cater for only one schoolchild. For him, one hectare of rice farming is a single income to support the entire household. He has engaged in the current business for 35 years, earning about 20,000 KHR per day. 

Hot and the other member of the group are the taking out their first loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  The requested loan of Hot is 1,000,000 KHR and of his joint member is 400,000 KHR. Hot is the leader of this group and will spend his loan portion to buy potash, rice seed, and to pay for labor cost. He hopes that he can increase his income for the sake of improving his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To buy potash, rice seed, and to pay for labor cost

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Virginia Del Pilar

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Esperanza.

En este lugar vive la señora Virginia, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos  mayores de edad, la menor aun vive con ellos. Su esposo es médico.

Doña Virginia es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y sentirse útil e independiente se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo, zapatos, carteras, entre otras cosas,  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale a recorrer por la localidad con sus productos y también vende en su casa, la mercadería se la envían desde los Estado Unidos,  deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 6  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, carteras y varios productos más. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The members of the ‘Nueva Esperanza’ [New Hope] communal bank meet every 15 days in the city of Santa Ana.  The city is known for its lovely scenery and its beautiful freshwater swimming areas, which are visited by a lot of tourists.

Virginia, age 60, lives in this place.  She is married, and they have four adult children.  The youngest still lives with them.  Her husband is a doctor.  Virginia is a housewife.  

In order to get her own resources and to feel useful and independent, she sells clothes by catalog, shoes, and purses, among other things.  She sells door to door by going around the area with her products.  She also sells at her house.  The merchandise is sent from the United States.  She sells her products on credit, and she collects every eight days.  She has been engaged in this business activity for over six years, and it is going very well for her.

This loan is to buy clothes, shoes, purses, and various other products.  She has been in her communal bank since it started.  She likes it because the payments are easy to make.  Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, purses, and various other products.

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita is 52 years old and lives in Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is single with no children. 

Purita grows corn and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers. Purita has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Purita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for her corn production

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch is the 48-year-old married mother of four dependent children and is a villager from the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Three of her children go to school while the remaining one is still too young for schooling. She earns a living by growing rice on one and a half hectares of land and planting cassava on another two hectares, in order to support the entire household. Her husband also manages a cashew plantation for extra income. After 18 years in her current business, she is now able to earn up to 29,200 Cambodian riel (KHR) per day. 

Touch is not a first time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her past two loan cycles have helped her to improve her lifestyle gradually and she has succeeded in repaying her loans already. For this cycle, she has formed a group of two to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and cassava seedlings for replanting season. She hopes that she can grow her cash-crop on time and earn more income to expand her agricultural business successfully.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and cassava seedlings

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Irma Leticia

texts.es:
Doña Irma es una mujer de 42 años de edad casada y madre de 3 hijos los cuales juntos en familia se dedican a la siembra y cultivo de café y granos básicos. Ella no tiene ningún grado de educación ya que sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos y no pudieron apoyarla con sus estudios. Ella tiene mucha experiencia en este tipo de actividad como lo es el cultivo de café y granos básicos ya que lo realiza hace más de 30 años y fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron dicha actividad desde muy pequeña. Su producto es vendido y comercializado con los diferentes compradores que llegan a la zona y las personas que están en los alrededores de su zona. El terreno que ellos cultiva es propio al cual en familia en compañía de su esposo y sus hijos se trasladan en vestía para dar el mantenimiento como: abonar, limpieza, corte y fertilización ya que de esta manera evitan que el producto sea dañado y se contamine de plagas.

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizante y abono para dar el mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café y tener una excelente cosecha.

Su sueño es seguir aumentando su cultivó para de esa manera generar más ingresos que le permitan seguir invirtiendo en su producción de café ya que uno de los más grandes desafíos es el constante aumento y el alza de los precios de los insumos mismos que son de gran ayuda para que la producción se pueda aprovechar en un 100% esto permitirá darle una mejor educación a sus hijos y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Irma is 42 years old.  She is married and has 3 children who live with her.  They plant and cultivate coffee crops and basic grains.  Irma does not have an education as her parents had scarce financial resources and could not provide for her education.  She has a lot of experience in this type of activity. She has been growing coffee and grains for more than 30 years as her parents taught her very young.  Her products are sold and commercialized by different buyers who come to the area, and by people who are in nearby areas.  The land that they cultivate is their own, and she travels by mule with along with her husband and children to do maintenance such as: applying fertilizer, cleaning up, cutting and fertilizing to prevent their crop from being damaged or contaminated by disease.  Irma is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers to maintain her coffee crops and have an excellent harvest.

Her dream is to continue to expand her crops to generate more income and continue investing in coffee production.  One of the greatest challenges is the constant increase in prices of supplies which are very helpful for ensuring that that they can use 100% of their production.  This will allow her to provide a better education to her children and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Delfina is 33 years old and she is now applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is married. She started her garden in 2000 with her own working capital of $50. She earns a good income from her business.

She will use her loan to buy some long beans to keep in her store. She is a very hard working woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 12 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy long beans

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es: Nelson es padre de dos hijos, su ingreso es único en su hogar, trabaja fuertemente para alcanzar sus metas, en este momento tiene como prioridad la reparación de su vivienda, ya que la época de lluvia ya llegó y necesita cambiar parte del techo, impermeabilizar paredes, hacer aceras, para esto solicita un millón de colones (¢1.000.000)con este dinero comprará zinc, madera, impermeabilizante, cemento, etc.  Nelson agradece la oportunidad del financiamiento comunal pues con este apoyo puede cumplir con las metas propuestas .
texts.en: Nelson has two children.  He provides the only income in the home.  He works hard to achieve his goals.  Right now his priority is to repair his home, as the rainy season has arrived and he needs to change part of the roof, waterproof the walls, and put in pavement.  For this purpose he is requesting a loan of one million Colones  (¢1.000.000). He will use this money to purchase zinc panels, wood, waterproofing, cement, etc.  Nelson is thankful for this loan opportunity because with this support he will be able to achieve his proposed goals.

loans.use: to purchase materials to repair his home.

loans.name: Vicenta Teodora

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Sirena se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Sirena en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Vicenta, tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es jubilado.

Doña Vicente tiene un pequeño negocio, vende ropa, sabanas y productos de Avon, Esika y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días ya que además de los recorridos que realiza también vende en su casa donde tiene unas vitrinas, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 9  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien. En su casa tiene departamentos que alquila y le genera un ingreso  extra con el que salen adelante ya que su esposo ya es jubilado y no trabaja.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Esta desde el  tercer ciclo que se formo este Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The La Sirena communal bank meets every 15 days in the La Sirena neighborhood in the city of Manta.  The city is known for its beautiful beaches, which are extremely popular during all seasons of the year.  This is because it is a breathtakingly beautiful city with a lot of tourist attractions.

Vicenta, age 57, lives in this place.  She is married, and they have three adult children who are independent.  Her husband is retired.  Vicente has a small business selling clothes, sheets, and Avon, Esika, and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories).

She works every day because, besides her sales route, she also sells at home, where she has some display cases.  She sells her products on credit, and she collects every eight days.  She has been engaged in this business activity for over nine years, and it is going very well for her.

At her house she has some apartments that she rents, and this generates an extra income.  With this income they get ahead because her husband is retired and does not work.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, and underwear.  She has been with her communal bank since its third cycle.  She likes it because of the help the loans provide.

Her dream is to get ahead in her business.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, and underwear.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Don Carlos es un señor muy trabajador. El desea lograr que su negocio aumente y mejorar el servicio, por lo que solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (1.000.000) para la compra de maquinas para realizar los masajes y de rayos infrarrojos. Con esto pretende crecer profesionalmente.
texts.en: Carlos is a very hard worker.  He would like to grow his business and improve his services. He is therefore requesting a loan of on million Colones (1.000.000) to purchase massage and infrared therapy equipment.  With this loan he hopes to grow professionally.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for massage and physical therapy.

loans.name: Amado

texts.es:
El Señor Amado es de la ciudad de Santaní, vive con sus padres, el señor se dedica a la venta de productos general, como ser calzados y prendas. Es un señor muy trabajador, responsable y muy honesto.
Cuenta que empezó a trabajar como vendedor  por la zona del mercado vendiendo zapatos y ropas usados, el señor viajaba a Ciudad del Este para traer sus productos así tener más ganancias para solventar los gastos de la familia, su sueño de siempre era tener su propio negocio para poder así tener una mejor calidad de vida, con su esfuerzo, trabajo y dedicación salió adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de calzados, y prendas de todo tipo, ya que estos son sus principales insumos que vende y ofrece a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Amado lives in the city of Santaní. He lives with his parents and works buy selling general products such as shoes and clothing. He is a hard-working, responsible, and honest man.

He says that he began working as a vendor in the market by selling used shoes and clothing. He traveled to Ciudad del Este to get the products and then have better profits to pay family expenses. His lifelong dream is to have his own business in order to have a better quality of life. With his efforts, work, and dedication, he will move forward.

He is requesting this loan to buy shoes and all kinds of clothing since these are the primary products that he sells and offers to customers.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothing to sell

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Sirena se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Sirena en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 40 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 22 y  11  años de edad, el menor de ellos estudia en escuela. El marido es chofer y tiene un transporte escolar y además es comerciante.
 
Doña Ana como buena esposa realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en su negocio, él además de dedicarse a realizar el expreso de personal también se dedica a la venta de queso, tres veces por semana se desplaza hasta Chone y Tosagua ciudades en las cuales compra el queso que luego lleva a distribuir a comerciantes minoristas en el mercado local, él lleva más de diez años dedicado al comercio negocio  con el cual ha sacado adelante a su familia sin que les falte nada.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar quesos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ella puede ayudar a sus marido y contribuir con los gastos del hogar.
 
Su sueño es comprar otro carro más nuevo.
texts.en:
The La Sirena communal bank meets every 15 days in the La Sirena neighborhood in the city of Manta.  The city is known for its beautiful beaches, which are extremely popular during all seasons of the year.  This is because it is a breathtakingly beautiful city with a lot of tourist attractions.

Ana, age 40, lives in this place.  She is in a common-law marriage, and they have two children, ages 22 and 11.  The younger goes to school.  Her husband is a driver and has a vehicle used for school transport, and he is also a salesman.

Ana, as a good wife, is getting the loan for her husband to use in his business.  In addition to his transportation business, he also sells cheese.  Three times a week he goes to Chone and Tosagua, the cities where he buys the cheese.  He later takes the cheese to distribute to the retailers at the local market.  He has been engaged in this business for over ten years.  Through the business he has gotten his family ahead without them lacking anything. 

She will use the new loan to buy cheese.  She has been in the communal bank since it began.  She likes it because, with the loans, she is able to help her husband and contribute to the household expenses.

Her dream is to buy a newer car.

loans.use: to buy cheese.

loans.name: Nonvignon 7 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVIGNON 7 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Assiba Fabrise Rose est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Assiba Fabrise Rose est âgée de 37 ans. Assiba Fabrise Rose n’a pas fréquenté l’école mais a appris la coiffure. Assiba Fabrise Rose est mariée à un certain Maurice. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Le couple vit avec leurs enfants. Assiba Fabrise Rose et son mari assurent ensemble les charges familiales. Pour ce faire, Assiba Fabrise Rose en dehors de son activité, vend des mèches et des produits cosmétiques à son domicile depuis une vingtaine d’année. Assiba Fabrise Rose s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Assiba Fabrise Rose sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON 7, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Nonvignon 7 group is made up of three friends who live in the same district. The representative of the group, whose name is Assiba Fabrise Rose, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 37 years old and, while she did not attend school, she learned the hairdressing trade. She is married to a man called Maurice and the couple has two children, who are both at school. The couple lives with their children. Assiba Fabrise Rose and her husband cover the family expenses between them. In order to do this, Assiba Fabrise Rose has, in addition to her hairdressing activity, been selling hair extensions and cosmetic products from her home for the past 20 years. She gets her supplies in one of Benin's markets. With a view to satisfying customer demand and in order to increase her turnover and income, Assiba Fabrise Rose is requesting, together with the other members of Nonvignon 7 group, a fourth loan from Alidé. The previous loans have been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and cosmetics.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
La señora Florentina tiene 63 años, es viuda desde hace 10 años, a partir de ahí lleva adelante por sí sola la mantención de la casa; tiene 6 hijos de los cuales cuatro ya están casadas y viven en forma independiente.
La Sra. Florentina se dedica al alquiler de sillas mesas y decoración para acontecimientos sociales desde hace 4 años, y cuenta que le está yendo muy bien ya que el servicio a sus clientes es muy bueno.
Solicita este préstamo para la compra de sillas, sillones, mesa, mesita, cubiertos y así ofrecer servicios de buena calidad a sus clientes. Esta agradecida por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Florentina, 63 years old, is a widow of 10 years. She now takes care of home maintenance herself. She has 6 children, four of whom are married and living independently. 

Florentina works by renting out chairs, tables, and decorations for social occasions. She has been in this business for four years and says that it is going very well because she provides very good service to her customers.

She is requesting this loan to buy chairs, small and large tables, and place settings to offer a good quality service to her customers. She is grateful for this opportunity that she and her family are receiving.

loans.use: to buy chairs, small and large tables, and place settings

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi vit avec sa conjointe et leurs 02 enfants qui vont à l‘école  à Lomé. Mr Koffi quant à lui est ouvrier dans une société de la place. Pour pouvoir joindre les deux bouts et assurer un avenir radieux à sa famille, il a ouvert une boutique dans laquelle il revend des denrées alimentaires. Sa femme est impliquée dans son activité et il est à quatrième prêt à WAGES. Ce prêt lui permettra de s’approvisionner en marchandises (riz, huile végétale, tomate en boite, sucre, détergents…). A l’avenir, mr Koffi voudrait devenir un grossiste et pouvoir assurer les moindres besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Koffi lives with his wife and their two children, who go to school in Lomé. Koffi himself is a laborer in a local company.In order to make ends meet and ensure a bright future for his family, he has opened a shop in which he sells groceries. His wife is also involved in his business and he is on his fourth loan from WAGES. This loan will enable him to get fresh supplies of rice, vegetable oil, canned tomatoes, sugar, detergents...In the future Koffi would like to become a wholesaler to be able to ensure his family's most basic needs.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 48 years old and lives in Cahayag, Tudela. She is married with one child. 

To earn a living, Corazon has a business selling snacks in the community. She earns about 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of work. Corazon has a requested a loan  to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, etc.

Corazon has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Corazon would like to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Cyanath Anne-Marie Claire

texts.fr: Cyanath Anne-Marie Claire âgée de 55 ans, est mariée à un certain de Ismaël. Le couple a un enfant qui n'est pas scolarisé. Le couple vit ensemble avec leur enfant. Cyanath Anne-Marie Claire n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Cyanath Anne-Marie Claire assiste son mari dans les diverses charges de la maison. Pour ce faire, Cyanath Anne-Marie Claire vend des thermos, des produits de toilettes (couches, layettes, etc.) depuis douze ans environ. En vue de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Cyanath Anne-Marie Claire sollicite pour la sixème fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits précédemment obtenus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Cyanath Anne-Marie Claire, who is 55 years old, is married to a man named Ismaël. The couple has one child who is not at school and they live with their child. Cyanath Anne-Marie Claire did not attend school. She helps out her husband with the various household expenses, and in order to do this, has been selling thermos flasks and clothing (nappies, babywear, etc.) for around 12 years. With a view to satisfying customer demand, Cyanath Anne-Marie Claire is requesting a sixth loan from Alidé. The previous loans that she has been granted have been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy thermos flasks, and babywear.

loans.name: Mariela Cecibel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Sirena se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Sirena en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señorita Valeria, tiene 24 años, está soltera y  vive en casa de sus padres,  estudia Marketing en una Universidad en Manta.
 
Valeria además de dedicarse a sus estudios también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatillas y productos de Cyzone (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta aunque la mayoría de sus ventas las realiza en el centro donde ella estudia ya que tiene varios clientes, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Lleva más 4 años con su negocio el cual le permite sacar adelante sus estudios.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatillas, cremas y perfumes. Lleva 4 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con esto empezó su negocio el cual le da  ganancias  para solventar los gastos de sus estudios.
 
Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y ser empresaria.
texts.en:
“La Sirena” Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in the La Sirena neighborhood in Manta.  The city is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited during all seasons of the year and for being a city of unsurpassed beauty with many tourist attractions.  In this place, lives Valeria.  She is 24 years old and single.  She lives in her parents’ home and studies Marketing at the university in Manta.  

In addition to her studies, Valeria is engaged in trade, selling all styles of clothing, shoes, and Cyzone products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and accessories for ladies).  She sells door-to-door although she conducts most of her sales at the center where she studies.  She has several customers there and she extends credit and collects payments every fifteen days.  She has been engaged in this business for four years and it helps her move forward with her studies.  

This loan is for the purchase of clothing, shoes, creams, and perfume.  She had been involved in the communal bank for four years and she enjoys it because it enabled her to start her business, which provides her with earnings to pay for her educational expenses.   Her dream is to complete her studies and become a businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, creams, and perfume.

loans.name: Condrada

texts.en:
Condrada is 69 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban. She is married with five children.
 
To earn a living, Condrada has a business selling dried fish in the community. She earns about 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of work. Condrada has requested a loan to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

Condrada has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Condrada would like to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Annie Rose

texts.en:
Annie Rose is married with two children. Annie Rose  is 35 years old and lives in Tipan, Sinacaban.

Annie Rose sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan for 30,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Annie Rose has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Annie Rose hope to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is married with three children. Rita is 54 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez.

Rita sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Rita has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Rita hope to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Nim

texts.en:
Originally from Kampong Cham province’s Ou Reang Ov district, Nim is 37 years old and married. She has three children, two of whom still rely on her, as one is helping with the household chores and a remaining one is in school. To deal with the daily cost of living, she grows paddy rice and cassava on 3 hectares each of farmland with the support from her husband. The current business has returned her about 38,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

Nim joins VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) as a first-loan-cycle client. She will spend her requested loan in the amount of 4,000,000 KHR in order to buy potash and pay plowing fees for her rice farm, and to pay labor costs for her cassava farm. She hopes that she can gain a high profit to better her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy potash, pay the plowing fee for her rice farm, and to pay for labor costs for her cassava farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Faosiath Adédjokè

texts.fr: Faosiath Adédjokè, âgée de 28 ans est mariée à un certain Farouk. Le couple n'a pas d'enfant. Faosiath Adédjokè n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Faosiath Adédjokè vend des mèches et des produits cosmétiques (produits de cheveux) depuis cinq ans par la méthode de distribution. Faosiath Adédjokè s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et au Togo. En vue de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Faosiath Adédjokè sollicite pour la sixième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits précédemment obtenus ont tous été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Faosiath Adédjokè, who is 28 years old, is married to a man named Farouk. The couple does not have any children. Faosiath Adédjoké did not attend school. In order to provide for her needs, she has been selling hair extensions and hair products for the past five years through the distribution system. She gets her supplies in one of Benin's markets and in Togo. With a view to satisfying customer demand, she is requesting a sixth loan from Alidé. The previous loans she has been granted have been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and hair products.

loans.name: Julia Rosario

texts.es:
La cliente Julia, vive en Guayaquil. Ella comienza su negocio de comida y cabinas telefónicas hace varios años atrás cuando tenia la necesidad de tener mas ingresos en su familia. Poco a poco puso un restaurante y con varios ingresos incluso los de su esposo también tuvieron unas cabinas telefónicas.    

En la actualidad tienen dos negocio, pero quieren seguri progresando para darle lo mejor a sus hijos ya que tiene tres que estudian en escuelas fiscales (en la foto Julia aparece con uno de sus hijos). 

Para poder capitalizar los estudios de sus hijos que ahora han entrado ha clases necesitan el crédito para los utiles escolares que le piden.
texts.en:
Julia lives in Guayaquil. She started her business of selling food and managing phone booths several years ago when she needed more income for her family. Over time she was able to open a restaurant and have multiple sources of income. Her husband also has a few phone booths that he manages.

Julia currently manages two businesses, but she wants to keep progressing so that she can provide the best for her children. She has three children who are studying at state schools. One of her children appears with her in the photo. Julia’s children have already enrolled in their classes, but she needs to fund their studies.
